[Rose Eternal Tavern]

Illumination from the dim oil lamps barely cuts through spilt drink and stale tobacco scented air.  A group of drag-als that seem to have become a permanent fixture here beckons you to join them for a pitcher of ale, and motions to the bartender indicating that you're paying.  Without bothering to acknowledge them, the bartender flashes a toothless grin toward a crowd more likely to have a few coins in their pockets, points them toward a table in the back and offers them an etched wood menu.  An open finely carved rosewood door and a small stage are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Zhen the Psycian, Panick the Noble Drag-al, Cleric the Noble Leuian, Alihtim the Noble Hithual, Thandril the Noble Leuian, and Starman the Frontacian.
Obvious exits: None.
>

>[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, a bronze battle-axe, an open ancient platinum box, and an open glittering platinum coffer are here.

This area is illuminated.
'Hroom see are Mental the Psycian, Umiak the San Elf, Quazzy the Leuian, Draclaw the Leuian, Nyoko the Drake (flying 20 feet above ground), and Vartac the Noble Secian
In the area are Mental the Psycian, Umiak the San Elf, Quazzy the Leuian, Draclaw the Leuian, Nyoko the Drake (flying 20 feet above ground), and Vartac the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Market Circle.]

Polished rosewood trim surrounds the door and windows of this tavern. A hand carved relief of intertwined roses adorns the front door, and the words "The Rose Eternal" stand out in gold leaf. Friendly chatter and spirited discussions in all languages can be heard from this famed establishment. Fine food and drink wait just inside.  An open finely carved rosewood door is here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st black bear (wearing a small gold collar).
In the room are Zhen the Psycian, Sordum the Psycian, Panick the Noble Drag-al, Rosi the Noble Secian, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Tygraa the Noble Leuian, Cleric the Noble Leuian, Alihtim the Noble Hithual, and Starman the Frontacian.
Obvious exits: northeast* east* northwest*.
gla at tha
I don't see what you are referring to.
>
You follow Panick northeast...

[Market Circle.]

An arch between two large buildings connects Market Circle and Market Street. The more reputable shopkeepers do business within the circle, but pay higher taxes for the privilege. The buildings have been built to last, as these merchants are no traveling tinkers. Interlocking stone walkways and colorful plantings span this central area. Despite the number of animals waiting outside the bank for their owners, the area is spotless. Loud chatter in many languages can be heard from the southwest.  A marble archway, an open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, and a wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st stone craftsman and the 1st black bear (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Zhen the Psycian, Sordum the Psycian, Panick the Noble Drag-al, Rosi the Noble Secian, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Tygraa the Noble Leuian, Cleric the Noble Leuian, Alihtim the Noble Hithual, and Starman the Frontacian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

You follow Panick northwest...

[Market Circle.]

By torchlight or daylight, the windows of this shop sparkle from the many faceted stones inside. The sight almost makes one forget the presence of two Thugian guards and their war dogs guarding the entrance. The etched window glass indicates this is Fredriquede Tiffany's place of business, widely regarded as the finest jeweler in the land.  An engraved marble plaque and an open banded steelwood door are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st black bear (wearing a small gold collar).
In the room are Zhen the Psycian, Sordum the Psycian, Panick the Noble Drag-al, Rosi the Noble Secian, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Tygraa the Noble Leuian, Cleric the Noble Leuian, Alihtim the Noble Hithual, Thandril the Noble Leuian, and Starman the Frontacian.
Obvious exits: northeast* southeast* south*.

You follow Panick through an open banded steelwood door...

[Fredriquede Tiffany's Fine Jewel and Gem Shoppe]

A flashy Drag-al merchant swaggers up to you, introduces himself as Fredriquede Tiffany, and starts loudly praising everything in his shop. You can hardly see his fingers for the oversized rings, and his heavy gold necklaces reveal a taste for the expensive more than the classy, but you have to grudgingly admit that he knows his gems.   An open banded steelwood door is here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st governor's dread knight and the 1st black bear (wearing a small gold collar).

[Market Circle.]

By torchlight or daylight, the windows of this shop sparkle from the many faceted stones inside. The sight almost makes one forget the presence of two Thugian guards and their war dogs guarding the entrance. The etched window glass indicates this is Fredriquede Tiffany's place of business, widely regarded as the finest jeweler in the land.  An engraved marble plaque and an open banded steelwood door are here.

[Fredriquede Tiffany's Fine Jewel and Gem Shoppe]

A flashy Drag-al merchant swaggers up to you, introduces himself as Fredriquede Tiffany, and starts loudly praising everything in his shop. You can hardly see his fingers for the oversized rings, and his heavy gold necklaces reveal a taste for the expensive more than the classy, but you have to grudgingly admit that he knows his gems. >[Old School Guild Hall]

Created solely for the enjoyment of true Old Schoolers, this lodge is adorned with relics older than most Spurians. The combined experience of those who gather here is incalculable, and everything has been designed with their comfort in mind. >[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, a bronze battle-axe, an open ancient platinum box, and an open glittering platinum coffer are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Anyah the Human and Solinus the Human.

Several large display cases stand against the sides of the room, slowly being filled with the relics fondly recalled from members' pasts. The spirits of long-departed friends, foes, heroes, and villains live on in a growing series of portraits. How many do you remember?  A luxurious amber velvet curtain, an open thick handmade oak door, and a closed antique glass display case are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st black bear (wearing a small gold collar).
In the room are Zhen the Psycian, Sordum the Psycian, Panick the Noble Drag-al, Rosi the Noble Secian, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Tygraa the Noble Leuian, Cleric the Noble Leuian, Alihtim the Noble Hithual, Thandril the Noble Leuian, and Starman the Frontacian.
Obvious exits: None.

He is bald, with dull black eyes, and looks razor-sharp.

He can be attacked by other players.

He appears to be in perfect health.

Physical appearance:

Renalk looks like a 5'10" standard young average boned, wirey-tough bodied San Elf RuneMage.
He has collar length, wavy, wiry reddish black hair, with pitch black eyes, and looks razor-sharp.
He appears to be distant right now.
He bears the mark of Sa.
He can be attacked by other players.
He appears to be in perfect health.

Physical appearance:

This Elf's youthful face is set in a stern, unfeeling expression, a perpetual frown with the occasional hint of a sneer. The dark eyes are just the opposite, deep pools of memory betraying his great age, and always flickering with emotion. 

                        Visible Equipment
A heavy dragon-etched orichalcum ceremonial armor  (armor)
A shadowy black hood                               (on head)
A shadowy black silk gloves                        (over hands)
A pair of highly polished black jack-boots         (on feet)
A shadowy black moonsilver embroidered cloak       (over armor)
A stunning blood red diamond band                  (ring (right))
An Emjedah coat of arms signet ring                (ring (right))
A black crystal morbius wedding band               (ring (left))
Some soft black tweed trousers                     (pants)
An ebony spidersilk shirt                          (shirt)
A slick black leather belt                         (on belt)
A closed moonsilver trimmed teak scroll case       (on belt)
An open flame-embroidered black silk beltpouch     (on belt)

  Noble of the Realm

Additional titles earned:
  Archmage of Emjedah

>                        You have visualized the following locations
                        -------------------------------------------

                                    Visualization #1 is:
A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past. 

                                    Visualization #2 is:
A cool draft from the archway to the northwest hits you in the face. You hear voices murmuring, almost chanting, beyond the arch. A narrow stairway leads upward, providing an alternate exit from this room.

                                    Visualization #3 is:
Everything in this room has been colored green. This is where you will wait until it is your time to enter the arena. Food and drink have been placed on the tables to help you pass the time. A door leads into the arena and a portal leads back to the OOC Inn.

Your active visualization is #2

[Old School Sparring Chamber]

Haul out your weapons, armor, and spells, and try them out! Many things have changed over the years, but knowing what your gear and skills can do is always important. Besides, a good brawl is good for the soul now and then. The walls and floor are thickly padded-- What are you waiting for?  An open battered oak door and a two-handed bronze pike are here.

[Old School Hall of Fame]

Several large display cases stand against the sides of the room, slowly being filled with the relics fondly recalled from members' pasts. The spirits of long-departed friends, foes, heroes, and villains live on in a growing series of portraits. How many do you remember?  A luxurious amber velvet curtain, an open thick handmade oak door, and a closed antique glass display case are here.

This room is illuminated.

[Old School Guild Hall]

Created solely for the enjoyment of true Old Schoolers, this lodge is adorned with relics older than most Spurians. The combined experience of those who gather here is incalculable, and everything has been designed with their comfort in mind. No matter what troubles might lie beyond these doors, you are among friends here.  A gleaming alabaster fountain, a luxurious amber velvet curtain, a closed rusting rune-etched door, a large crystal bowl of sparkling punch, a large moonsilver tray, a large crystalla plate, and a large etched silver serving tray are here.

[Market Circle.]

By torchlight or daylight, the windows of this shop sparkle from the many faceted stones inside. The sight almost makes one forget the presence of two Thugian guards and their war dogs guarding the entrance. [Market Circle.]

An arch between two large buildings connects Market Circle and Market Street. The more reputable shopkeepers do business within the circle, but pay higher taxes for the privilege. The buildings have been built to last, as these merchants are no traveling tinkers. Interlocking stone walkways and colorful plantings span this central area. Despite the number of animals waiting outside the bank for their owners, the area is spotless. Loud chatter in many languages can be heard from the southwest.  A marble archway, an open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, and a wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Market Street.]

[Market Street.]

Situated between the well-traveled Trade Way to the north and the fine shops of Market Circle to the south, this small stretch of road is busy at all times of day. [Trade & Market.]

The buildings of Market Circle stand to the south. It becomes obvious that the area through the arch is a much cleaner marketplace than the bazaar. An inviting eatery stands beside the road, its door open to those weary after a long trip to Spur, as well as those preparing to venture to the great expanses beyond the west gate. A human couple exit the building, arm in arm. A small sign stands beside the intersection.  A sign, an open glossy lacquered oak door, and a street lantern are here.

[Trade Way.]

This well-worn road separates the Bazaar to the north and Market Circle to the south. Only a Thugian could appreciate the layered odors of simmering foodstuffs and shoppers from the Bazaar. [Trade Way & Bazaar Path.]

[Trade Way.]

Many townsfolk pass along this busy thoroughfare. Rich and poor alike mix freely on this street, much to the dismay of a passing nobleman. [Trade Way.]

A large gate separates the Merchant District and Town Square-the hub of Spur's activity. The partially opened gate is currently able to accommodate the simultaneous passage of several locals and visitors, but can be expanded to accept carriages, or sealed to ward against invasion. [Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, a bronze battle-axe, an open ancient platinum box, and an open glittering platinum coffer are here.

High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, a bronze battle-axe, an open ancient platinum box, an open glittering platinum coffer, and a bottle of fine anthian wine are here.

This area is illuminated.

Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. [Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern and some charred foliage are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st raccoon (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Sordum the Psycian, Phannah the Noble Human, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Panick the Noble Drag-al, Lobos the Arachnian, Jedaka the Novice Leuian, Vixen the Noble San Elf, Tygraa the Noble Leuian, Alynia the Psycian, Dhameon the Human, and Alihtim the Noble Hithual.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.

You follow Panick south...

[Southern Avenue.]

Smooth stones make up the street that leads from the center of Spur to the south. Each stone has been carefully fitted for the most comfortable travel by both cart and traveler alike. A well dressed Guard patrols the area in his dress uniform. Captains don't allow for slovenly appearances on this patrol.  A street lantern is here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st raccoon (wearing a small gold collar).
In the room are Sordum the Psycian, Phannah the Noble Human, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Panick the Noble Drag-al, Lobos the Arachnian, Jedaka the Novice Leuian, Vixen the Noble San Elf, Tygraa the Noble Leuian, Alynia the Psycian, Dhameon the Human, and Alihtim the Noble Hithual.
Obvious exits: north* south*.

You follow Panick south...

[Southern Avenue.]

Southern Avenue leads between the center of Spur and the homes of the prosperous and wealthy. Several of the Ladies of the city stroll along the avenue chatting about the current events and latest gossip of the Spur. Behind them, harried servants carry their reticules and all those belongings that they cannot be without.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st raccoon (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Sordum the Psycian, Phannah the Noble Human, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Panick the Noble Drag-al, Lobos the Arachnian, Jedaka the Novice Leuian, Vixen the Noble San Elf, Tygraa the Noble Leuian, Alynia the Psycian, Dhameon the Human, and Alihtim the Noble Hithual.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Panick south...

[Southern Avenue.]

Vast estates tower over the huge Spurian wall towards the south. The well-to-do who live in these homes idle away their days, enjoying the luxury of time. Standing next to a very empty lantern pole, a small Flerian child insists in a plaintive wail, that he had nothing to do with the missing lantern. The well-dressed guard that interrogates him keeps pointing at a small sack on the ground and its obvious contents.  An open small burlap sack and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st guard and the 1st raccoon (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Sordum the Psycian, Phannah the Noble Human, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Panick the Noble Drag-al, Lobos the Arachnian, Jedaka the Novice Leuian, Vixen the Noble San Elf, Tygraa the Noble Leuian, Alynia the Psycian, Dhameon the Human, and Alihtim the Noble Hithual.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Panick south...

[Southern Avenue & Gorey Street.]

The boughs of a large apple tree hang over the well tended avenue. Below the beautiful tree stands a small fountain. Atop the fountain is an intricately carved Secian who appears to be dancing with the water as it splashes around her. Set in the marble base is a small plaque that reads, "For those who have gone before us." Many stand for a moment as they pass this way, giving thanks for the gift of life that is given by both the apple tree and the Secians of long ago. Large piles of dirt and broken stone lay on either side of the street as workmen ready the east and west alleys for expansion.  A street lantern, a Secian etched moonsilver door, a pair of open silver forged swinging doors, and a sign above the doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st raven (wearing a small gold collar) and the 1st raccoon (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Sordum the Psycian, Phannah the Noble Human, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Panick the Noble Drag-al, Lobos the Arachnian, Jedaka the Novice Leuian, Vixen the Noble San Elf, Tygraa the Noble Leuian, Alynia the Psycian, Dhameon the Human, and Alihtim the Noble Hithual.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west.

The raven cleans itself with its beak.

You follow Panick south...

[Southern Avenue.]

Standing next to the large iron gate that separates the center of town from those of the elite class are several of the Spurian Guard. They are here to assist all who pass with the simple kindness of opening a gate, or the more important task of escorting those in need to the bank or market. A young looking cadet rubs wax into the stones of the city wall, his task is daunting, but one that will teach him discipline.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

[Gateway.]

An elegant, carved wooden sign hangs above the ornate gateway set into the massive wall that divides Spurs Noble District from the Town Square. You can make out city guardsmen peering down attentively at all that approach from their posts atop the imposing wall. They seem to take a greater interest in this part of town, though there does not seem to be anything threatening enough here to warrant such attention.  A gilded silver plaque and a street lantern are here.

[Noble Way.]

The area brightens.
[South gate.]

Through the gate lies the city of Spur, the major center of trade and civilization on the plains. The dusty road leading through the gates is well traveled, and walls of the city are in good repair. A small shack sits to the west of the road, during most times of the day a dusty coach can be seen waiting in front, its horses stomping with impatience to be gone. To the right of the door is a small window, its opening covered with metal bars. An old man, missing most of his teeth, waits patiently for the travelers to pay their fare, and then directs them into the waiting area. On the east side of the road a billowing multicolored tent has been erected, the hustle and bustle of merchants and customers can be seen coming and going at all times of the day.  A rainbow silk tent and an open iron gate are here.

[Wilderness gate.]

Set within a wide tunnel leading through the hedge to the north is the Wilderness Gate. It separates the settled lands of Spur from the open plains to the south of the city. The plains stretch as far as the eyes can see, the horizon and the walls of the fort down the road the only blemishes of the grassy landscape in the distance. The stones of the road are smoothly set together, well built to withstand heavy travel. A broken wagon wheel, discarded some time ago, covers a spot of nearby grass, weeds trying to climb through the spokes.  Some glowing festive rainbow diamond lanterns are here.

[Southern Tradeway.]

The tradeway runs across the open grasslands northeast towards the Spur, and southwest towards distant lands and eventually, the coast. The plains to the south and east seem totally indifferent to your existence. Just ahead, a small path moves up a village of huts spread out in a semi-circle. In the center of the village a giant fire pit sits where barbarians who wander through the village can sit around to stay warm. [Southern Tradeway.]

The stone paved tradeway stretches across the open plains, interrupting nature's task of consuming the land. An endless sea of grass surrounds you, lapping at the road much like the tides against a beach. The faintly damp wind occasionally blowing in from the west smells of earth. Some of the stones in the road interlock together to form the crude image of a lion. There is no discerning if it was done on purpose or sheer accident.  Some glowing festive rainbow diamond lanterns are here.

You follow Panick southwest...

[Southern Tradeway.]

Only the well-built, stone tradeway gives any hint of civilization ever having had any presence here. The tall grasses limit visibility nearby, hiding any wildlife that may be waiting for prey to stumble too close. A few blades of grass sway slightly in the breeze, some of them broken by the passing of something heavy over them. One of the larger stones in the road, broken loose from its mortar, waits patiently to be repaired.   Some glowing festive rainbow diamond lanterns are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st raccoon (wearing a small gold collar).

Panick laughs at Cleric.

You follow Panick southwest...

[Southern Tradeway.]

The grass rises taller and taller in every direction further limiting view just off the roadside. A second glance reveals that this is the lowest point in a large, shallow depression. The tradeway sinks a little lower as it gets closer to the river off to the west. A ditch runs alongside the river's side of the road, small puddles of water filling the bottom. Trickles filter into the puddles from the grass beyond as mosquitoes dart across the muddy surfaces.  Some glowing festive rainbow diamond lanterns are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Southern Tradeway.]

Rising up out of the plains, a large walled fort receives the end of the stone road. The river flows from either side, running through the fort from this angle of view. The vegetation surrounding the tradeway at this point has been burned out recently, allowing a clear field of vision from the tops of the walls ahead. The stones show little wear from the heavy traffic of feet and wheels alike; it has certainly been well constructed.  Some glowing festive rainbow diamond lanterns are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Meetpoint gate.]

The tradeways path leads directly to the imposing north-eastern gate of a stately fort. Even from this distance, the sounds of commerce and progress ring loudly as the harnesses of trader wagons jingle along the busy roadway and saws buzz noisily.The tradeway is constantly full of traffic going in both directions.   Some glowing festive rainbow diamond lanterns are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st raccoon (wearing a small gold collar).

[Meetpoint.]

Two guards patrol above the gate, looking you over carefully before giving leave to pass through the heavy wood gate. Thick and long wooden ladders serve up to the guard's posts high in the sky so that they may have some relief from their duties overlooking the land and city. Through the slates of the wooden walkways, you can make out four archers playing a game of cards, weapons at the ready. A whip cracks loudly as a caravan heads out the gate towards Spur.  A glowing wrought iron lantern and some glowing festive rainbow diamond lanterns are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st raccoon (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Sordum the Psycian, Phannah the Noble Human (holding a glowing delicately engraved moonsilver lamp), Renalk the Noble San Elf, Panick the Noble Drag-al, Lobos the Arachnian, Jedaka the Novice Leuian, Vixen the Noble San Elf, Tygraa the Noble Leuian, Alynia the Psycian, Dhameon the Human, Cleric the Noble Leuian, and Alihtim the Noble Hithual.
Obvious paths: southeast southwest* west* northwest.

You follow Panick west...

[Meetpoint, Leuian Festival.]

The sound of good cheer travels quickly on the otherwise heavy summer air, as a warm breeze rolls from the plains. Yellow, turquoise, purple, and white bunting drape loosely from wooden poles, forming a colorful collection of small tents. Winding from ten to tent, a narrow path ribbons itself. The path's outline is framed ornately by a mixture of tropical plants and flowers, reminiscent of Leuia, home sweet home. A colorful menagerie of individuals meander merrily as roars of laughter ring throughout the festival.  An open fragrant green and yellow tent flap, an open purple ribboned tent flap, an open wave patterned tent flap, and some glowing festive rainbow diamond lanterns are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st raccoon (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Sordum the Psycian, Phannah the Noble Human (holding a glowing delicately engraved moonsilver lamp), Renalk the Noble San Elf, Panick the Noble Drag-al, Lobos the Arachnian, Jedaka the Novice Leuian, Vixen the Noble San Elf, Tygraa the Noble Leuian, Alynia the Psycian, Dhameon the Human, Cleric the Noble Leuian, and Alihtim the Noble Hithual.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Panick west...

[Leuian Festival, Fire Pit.]

As the trail from the festival grounds disappears, the long grass parts entering into a small clearing. The ground has been flattened and is well worn with pieces of metal and stone speckled throughout the dirt. A large pit has been dug into the center with a raging fire burning inside. The breeze picks up, rippling the grass and making the nearby tents seem to float on a sea of grass. Several large, well worn rocks rest around the fire pit, and piles of small animal bones and blackened skewers are scattered around.  An icy keg of Khatyr ale, some glowing festive rainbow diamond lanterns, an open tall steaming steel pot, a closed tall steaming steel pot, a closed flaming iron grill, an open icy barrel, a closed chilled bin, and an open icy barrel are here.

[Leuian Festival, Fire Pit.]

As the trail from the festival grounds disappears, the long grass parts entering into a small clearing. The ground has been flattened and is well worn with pieces of metal and stone speckled throughout the dirt. A large pit has been dug into the center with a raging fire burning inside. The breeze picks up, rippling the grass and making the nearby tents seem to float on a sea of grass. Several large, well worn rocks rest around the fire pit, and piles of small animal bones and blackened skewers are scattered around.  An icy keg of Khatyr ale, some glowing festive rainbow diamond lanterns, an open tall steaming steel pot, an open tall steaming steel pot, an open flaming iron grill, an open icy barrel, an open chilled bin, an open icy barrel, a glass vial, a glass vial, a glass vial, a glass vial, a small flawless tiger's eye charm, a glass vial, and a glass vial are here.

[Meetpoint, Leuian Festival.]

The sound of good cheer travels quickly on the otherwise heavy summer air, as a warm breeze rolls from the plains. Yellow, turquoise, purple, and white bunting drape loosely from wooden poles, forming a colorful collection of small tents. Winding from ten to tent, a narrow path ribbons itself. The path's outline is framed ornately by a mixture of tropical plants and flowers, reminiscent of Leuia, home sweet home. A colorful menagerie of individuals meander merrily as roars of laughter ring throughout the festival.  An open fragrant green and yellow tent flap, an open purple ribboned tent flap, an open wave patterned tent flap, and some glowing festive rainbow diamond lanterns are here.

[Meetpoint.]

Two guards patrol above the gate, looking you over carefully before giving leave to pass through the heavy wood gate. Thick and long wooden ladders serve up to the guard's posts high in the sky so that they may have some relief from their duties overlooking the land and city. Through the slates of the wooden walkways, you can make out four archers playing a game of cards, weapons at the ready. A whip cracks loudly as a caravan heads out the gate towards Spur.  A glowing wrought iron lantern and some glowing festive rainbow diamond lanterns are here.

[Meetpoint gate.]

The tradeways path leads directly to the imposing north-eastern gate of a stately fort. Even from this distance, the sounds of commerce and progress ring loudly as the harnesses of trader wagons jingle along the busy roadway and saws buzz noisily.The tradeway is constantly full of traffic going in both directions.   Some glowing festive rainbow diamond lanterns are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Southern Tradeway.]

Rising up out of the plains, a large walled fort receives the end of the stone road. The river flows from either side, running through the fort from this angle of view. The vegetation surrounding the tradeway at this point has been burned out recently, allowing a clear field of vision from the tops of the walls ahead. The stones show little wear from the heavy traffic of feet and wheels alike; it has certainly been well constructed.  Some glowing festive rainbow diamond lanterns are here.

[Southern Tradeway.]

The grass rises taller and taller in every direction further limiting view just off the roadside. A second glance reveals that this is the lowest point in a large, shallow depression. The tradeway sinks a little lower as it gets closer to the river off to the west. A ditch runs alongside the river's side of the road, small puddles of water filling the bottom. Trickles filter into the puddles from the grass beyond as mosquitoes dart across the muddy surfaces.  Some glowing festive rainbow diamond lanterns are here.

[Southern Tradeway.]

Only the well-built, stone tradeway gives any hint of civilization ever having had any presence here. The tall grasses limit visibility nearby, hiding any wildlife that may be waiting for prey to stumble too close. A few blades of grass sway slightly in the breeze, some of them broken by the passing of something heavy over them. One of the larger stones in the road, broken loose from its mortar, waits patiently to be repaired.   Some glowing festive rainbow diamond lanterns are here.

[Southern Tradeway.]

The stone paved tradeway stretches across the open plains, interrupting nature's task of consuming the land. An endless sea of grass surrounds you, lapping at the road much like the tides against a beach. The faintly damp wind occasionally blowing in from the west smells of earth. Some of the stones in the road interlock together to form the crude image of a lion. There is no discerning if it was done on purpose or sheer accident.  Some glowing festive rainbow diamond lanterns are here.

[Southern Tradeway.]

The tradeway runs across the open grasslands northeast towards the Spur, and southwest towards distant lands and eventually, the coast. The plains to the south and east seem totally indifferent to your existence. Just ahead, a small path moves up a village of huts spread out in a semi-circle. In the center of the village a giant fire pit sits where barbarians who wander through the village can sit around to stay warm.  A worn grassy path and some glowing festive rainbow diamond lanterns are here.

[Wilderness gate.]

Set within a wide tunnel leading through the hedge to the north is the Wilderness Gate. It separates the settled lands of Spur from the open plains to the south of the city. The plains stretch as far as the eyes can see, the horizon and the walls of the fort down the road the only blemishes of the grassy landscape in the distance. The stones of the road are smoothly set together, well built to withstand heavy travel. A broken wagon wheel, discarded some time ago, covers a spot of nearby grass, weeds trying to climb through the spokes.  Some glowing festive rainbow diamond lanterns are here.

[South gate.]

Through the gate lies the city of Spur, the major center of trade and civilization on the plains. The dusty road leading through the gates is well traveled, and walls of the city are in good repair. A small shack sits to the west of the road, during most times of the day a dusty coach can be seen waiting in front, its horses stomping with impatience to be gone. To the right of the door is a small window, its opening covered with metal bars. An old man, missing most of his teeth, waits patiently for the travelers to pay their fare, and then directs them into the waiting area. On the east side of the road a billowing multicolored tent has been erected, the hustle and bustle of merchants and customers can be seen coming and going at all times of the day.  A rainbow silk tent and an open iron gate are here.

[Southern Avenue.]

Standing next to the large iron gate that separates the center of town from those of the elite class are several of the Spurian Guard. They are here to assist all who pass with the simple kindness of opening a gate, or the more important task of escorting those in need to the bank or market. [Southern Avenue & Gorey Street.]

The boughs of a large apple tree hang over the well tended avenue. Below the beautiful tree stands a small fountain. Atop the fountain is an intricately carved Secian who appears to be dancing with the water as it splashes around her. Set in the marble base is a small plaque that reads, "For those who have gone before us." Many stand for a moment as they pass this way, giving thanks for the gift of life that is given by both the apple tree and the Secians of long ago. Large piles of dirt and broken stone lay on either side of the street as workmen ready the east and west alleys for expansion.  A street lantern, a Secian etched moonsilver door, a pair of open silver forged swinging doors, and a sign above the doors are here.

[Southern Avenue.]

Vast estates tower over the huge Spurian wall towards the south. The well-to-do who live in these homes idle away their days, enjoying the luxury of time. [Southern Avenue.]

Southern Avenue leads between the center of Spur and the homes of the prosperous and wealthy. Several of the Ladies of the city stroll along the avenue chatting about the current events and latest gossip of the Spur. Behind them, harried servants carry their reticules and all those belongings that they cannot be without.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st raccoon (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Phannah the Noble Human (holding a glowing delicately engraved moonsilver lamp), Panick the Noble Drag-al, Jedaka the Novice Leuian, Tygraa the Noble Leuian, Dhameon the Human, Cleric the Noble Leuian, and Alihtim the Noble Hithual.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Panick north...

[Southern Avenue.]

Smooth stones make up the street that leads from the center of Spur to the south. Each stone has been carefully fitted for the most comfortable travel by both cart and traveler alike. A well dressed Guard patrols the area in his dress uniform. Captains don't allow for slovenly appearances on this patrol.  A street lantern is here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st raccoon (wearing a small gold collar).
In the room are Phannah the Noble Human (holding a glowing delicately engraved moonsilver lamp), Panick the Noble Drag-al, Jedaka the Novice Leuian, Tygraa the Noble Leuian, Dhameon the Human, Cleric the Noble Leuian, and Alihtim the Noble Hithual.
Obvious exits: north* south*.

You follow Panick north...

[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern and some charred foliage are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st raccoon (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Phannah the Noble Human (holding a glowing delicately engraved moonsilver lamp), Panick the Noble Drag-al, Jedaka the Novice Leuian, Tygraa the Noble Leuian, Dhameon the Human, Cleric the Noble Leuian, and Alihtim the Noble Hithual.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.

Panick inhales.

You follow Panick north...

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, a bronze battle-axe, an open ancient platinum box, an open glittering platinum coffer, some silver coins, and a bronze bastard sword are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st red-eyed black vulture (wearing a small gold collar) and the 1st raccoon (wearing a small gold collar).

Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, a bronze battle-axe, an open ancient platinum box, an open glittering platinum coffer, some silver coins, and a bronze bastard sword are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern and some charred foliage are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.

She is bald, with almond shaped dark gray eyes, and looks spotless.
She appears to be distant right now.
She can be attacked by other players.

On her wingtips, along the bottom corners, is a tattoo of an intricate lightning bolt before a shower of stars.

She appears to be in perfect health.

Physical appearance:

An inner strength flows from her, quiet and calm, like the light of her wings.  Her dark gray eyes flare with inner fire, her ivory claws glistening in the light.  A emerald tinged frill rises and falls along the top of her head and neck.

>[Town Square North.]

The traffic on the northern street heading away from town square is an eclectic bunch.  Those who belong to the guilds to the north travel in packs on their way to and from guild events.  It is not unusual to see a group of armored fighters passing a group of robed clerics, each heading in the opposite direction. The large temple of Rinanni rises to the north, its white marble almost glowing in the light.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* southeast* south* southwest* west*.
>
Tygraa says, "Think it's time for a khatnap"
l w
[Town Square West.]

People carrying bundles stream in from the west and rapidly lose themselves in the large crowds moving about in the vast town square. Several citizens head west with bulging coinpurses babbling excitedly about what they're going to purchase. Giggling children dart around the slower moving folks rushing on their way to spend the silvers in their pockets.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st sheep corpse.
In the area is Skuzzle the Go-blin-al.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* west*.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, and a rosewood sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st raccoon (wearing a small gold collar) and the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Lucia the Noble San Elf (an eagle upon her left shoulder), Equality the Noble Secian, Phannah the Noble Human (holding a glowing delicately engraved moonsilver lamp), Renalk the Noble San Elf, Panick the Noble Drag-al, Skuzzle the Go-blin-al, Slade the Psycian, Tygraa the Noble Leuian, Nyoko the Drake, Dhameon the Human, Cleric the Noble Leuian, and Alihtim the Noble Hithual.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, and a rosewood sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st raccoon (wearing a small gold collar) and the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

[Town Square East.]

Travel to the eastern portion of Town Square finds battle clad warriors shoulder to shoulder with chained criminals and those who live outside the Spurian Walls. The cobblestones that line the street are stained with blood.  It is unknown as to whether the blood is from guards carrying out quick executions, or gladiators who refused to wait their turn for arena space.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st ten-headed hydra, the 2nd ten-headed hydra, the 1st planar imp (wearing a small gold collar), and the 1st raccoon (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Equality the Noble Secian, Phannah the Noble Human (holding a glowing delicately engraved moonsilver lamp), Panick the Noble Drag-al, Quazzy the Leuian, Railt the Noble Penthanian (a planar imp upon his left shoulder), Thumpya the Drag-al, Nyoko the Drake, Vartac the Noble Secian, Dhameon the Human, Cleric the Noble Leuian (lying down), and Alihtim the Noble Hithual.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern and some charred foliage are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st giant red and black fiery salamander.

[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern and some charred foliage are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st giant red and black fiery salamander and the 1st raccoon (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Equality the Noble Secian, Orlando the Noble Human, Phannah the Noble Human (holding a glowing delicately engraved moonsilver lamp), Teef the Human (seated), Panick the Noble Drag-al, Leanne the Leuian, Quazzy the Leuian, Audun the Noble Leuian, Thumpya the Drag-al, Nominus the Leuian, Nyoko the Drake, Vartac the Noble Secian, Mathemas the Leuian, Dhameon the Human, Alihtim the Noble Hithual, and Hott the Noble Leuian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, and a rosewood sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar) and the 1st planar imp (wearing a small gold collar).

[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern and some charred foliage are here.

[Town Square.]

The elegant Hotel Royale towers above the street, its emerald door sparkling in the light. The patrons that stroll in and out are catered to, doors opened and closed for them, and baggage and packages carried by harried servants. The large Bank of Spur sits on the east side of the square. [Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, and a rosewood sign are here.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, and a rosewood sign are here.

[Town Square North.]

The traffic on the northern street heading away from town square is an eclectic bunch.  Those who belong to the guilds to the north travel in packs on their way to and from guild events.  It is not unusual to see a group of armored fighters passing a group of robed clerics, each heading in the opposite direction. The large temple of Rinanni rises to the north, its white marble almost glowing in the light.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* southeast* south* southwest* west*.
>[Town Square.]

Two elegant buildings, one to the north and one to the west, stand on either side of a quickly degrading road. Nattily dressed patrons of the two establishments hurry to their destination, not pausing for fear of being robbed, or worse. To the northwest the houses steadily become more decrepit. A dark pallor of smoky air hangs heavily over the area.  A street lantern and a heavy mahogany door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* southeast* south* west* northwest*.
>[Town Square West.]

People carrying bundles stream in from the west and rapidly lose themselves in the large crowds moving about in the vast town square. Several citizens head west with bulging coinpurses babbling excitedly about what they're going to purchase. Giggling children dart around the slower moving folks rushing on their way to spend the silvers in their pockets.  A street lantern is here.

>[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern and some charred foliage are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Orlando the Noble Human.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.
>[Town Square.]

The elegant Hotel Royale towers above the street, its emerald door sparkling in the light. The patrons that stroll in and out are catered to, doors opened and closed for them, and baggage and packages carried by harried servants. The large Bank of Spur sits on the east side of the square. Its location close to the Royale is not a coincidence. A gold-trimmed door is proof of the success of this branch of the Spurian bank and those who run it.  An elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, open emerald steel door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* southeast* west* northwest*.
>[Town Square East.]

Travel to the eastern portion of Town Square finds battle clad warriors shoulder to shoulder with chained criminals and those who live outside the Spurian Walls. The cobblestones that line the street are stained with blood.  It is unknown as to whether the blood is from guards carrying out quick executions, or gladiators who refused to wait their turn for arena space.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* southwest* west* northwest*.
>[Town Square.]

A large sign reading "Spurian Hostel" hangs from a two story, plain oak building on the northern side of the square. Small children, who earn a few silver for their work, watch over the many merchant and traveler's carts that sit in front. Towards the east you can hear a low chanting combined with the murmur of deep discussion from those who visit the Psion Center.  A wooden sign, a street lantern, and an open sturdy wooden door are here.

[Town Square North.]

The traffic on the northern street heading away from town square is an eclectic bunch.  Those who belong to the guilds to the north travel in packs on their way to and from guild events.  It is not unusual to see a group of armored fighters passing a group of robed clerics, each heading in the opposite direction. The large temple of Rinanni rises to the north, its white marble almost glowing in the light.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st beggar and the 2nd beggar.
Obvious paths: north* east* southeast* south* southwest* west*.
>[Town Square.]

Two elegant buildings, one to the north and one to the west, stand on either side of a quickly degrading road. Nattily dressed patrons of the two establishments hurry to their destination, not pausing for fear of being robbed, or worse. To the northwest the houses steadily become more decrepit. A dark pallor of smoky air hangs heavily over the area.  A street lantern and a heavy mahogany door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* southeast* south* west* northwest*.
>[Town Square West.]

People carrying bundles stream in from the west and rapidly lose themselves in the large crowds moving about in the vast town square. Several citizens head west with bulging coinpurses babbling excitedly about what they're going to purchase. Giggling children dart around the slower moving folks rushing on their way to spend the silvers in their pockets.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* west*.
>[Town Square.]

Commercial buildings flank Town Square to the west and south of this corner. Imposing buildings stand stiffly to your west, while those to the south have a slightly seedy look about them.  The door to the west has a freshly painted sign over it,  "Under New Management."  A closed tan weathered pine door, a large doorway, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Alaytra the Noble Psycian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southwest*.

l se

>[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern and some charred foliage are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.
>[Town Square.]

The elegant Hotel Royale towers above the street, its emerald door sparkling in the light. The patrons that stroll in and out are catered to, doors opened and closed for them, and baggage and packages carried by harried servants. The large Bank of Spur sits on the east side of the square. Its location close to the Royale is not a coincidence. A gold-trimmed door is proof of the success of this branch of the Spurian bank and those who run it.  An elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, open emerald steel door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* southeast* west* northwest*.
>[Town Square East.]

Travel to the eastern portion of Town Square finds battle clad warriors shoulder to shoulder with chained criminals and those who live outside the Spurian Walls. The cobblestones that line the street are stained with blood.  It is unknown as to whether the blood is from guards carrying out quick executions, or gladiators who refused to wait their turn for arena space.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* southwest* west* northwest*.
>[Town Square.]

A large sign reading "Spurian Hostel" hangs from a two story, plain oak building on the northern side of the square. Small children, who earn a few silver for their work, watch over the many merchant and traveler's carts that sit in front. Towards the east you can hear a low chanting combined with the murmur of deep discussion from those who visit the Psion Center.  A wooden sign, a street lantern, and an open sturdy wooden door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* east* south* southwest* west*.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, and a rosewood sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar) and the 1st planar imp (wearing a small gold collar).

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, and a rosewood sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st planar imp (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Loden the Noble Hithual, Solinus the Human, Haberthan the Hithual, Equality the Noble Secian, Ward the Leuian, Renalk the Noble San Elf, Panick the Noble Drag-al, Mental the Psycian, Bethany the Noble Psycian, Xaphania the San Elf, Rev the Noble Hithual, Ocinaiya the Noble Drag-al, Naomi the Leuian, Railt the Noble Penthanian (a planar imp upon his left shoulder), Firebreath the Noble Drake, Nicki the Hithual, Kalann the Noble Penthanian, Anyah the Human, Nyoko the Drake, Vartac the Noble Secian, and Fathom the Psycian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Town Square North.]

The traffic on the northern street heading away from town square is an eclectic bunch.  Those who belong to the guilds to the north travel in packs on their way to and from guild events.  It is not unusual to see a group of armored fighters passing a group of robed clerics, each heading in the opposite direction. The large temple of Rinanni rises to the north, its white marble almost glowing in the light.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* southeast* south* southwest* west*.
>[Town Square.]

Two elegant buildings, one to the north and one to the west, stand on either side of a quickly degrading road. Nattily dressed patrons of the two establishments hurry to their destination, not pausing for fear of being robbed, or worse. To the northwest the houses steadily become more decrepit. A dark pallor of smoky air hangs heavily over the area.  A street lantern and a heavy mahogany door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* southeast* south* west* northwest*.
>[Town Square West.]

People carrying bundles stream in from the west and rapidly lose themselves in the large crowds moving about in the vast town square. Several citizens head west with bulging coinpurses babbling excitedly about what they're going to purchase. Giggling children dart around the slower moving folks rushing on their way to spend the silvers in their pockets.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* west*.
>[Town Square.]

Commercial buildings flank Town Square to the west and south of this corner. Imposing buildings stand stiffly to your west, while those to the south have a slightly seedy look about them.  The door to the west has a freshly painted sign over it,  "Under New Management."  A closed tan weathered pine door, a large doorway, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southwest*.
l s
l se
l e
l ne
>[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern and some charred foliage are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.
>[Town Square.]

The elegant Hotel Royale towers above the street, its emerald door sparkling in the light. The patrons that stroll in and out are catered to, doors opened and closed for them, and baggage and packages carried by harried servants. The large Bank of Spur sits on the east side of the square. Its location close to the Royale is not a coincidence. A gold-trimmed door is proof of the success of this branch of the Spurian bank and those who run it.  An elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, open emerald steel door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st townsman and the 2nd townsman.
Obvious paths: north* southeast* west* northwest*.
>[Town Square East.]

Travel to the eastern portion of Town Square finds battle clad warriors shoulder to shoulder with chained criminals and those who live outside the Spurian Walls. The cobblestones that line the street are stained with blood.  It is unknown as to whether the blood is from guards carrying out quick executions, or gladiators who refused to wait their turn for arena space.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* southwest* west* northwest*.
>[Town Square.]

A large sign reading "Spurian Hostel" hangs from a two story, plain oak building on the northern side of the square. Small children, who earn a few silver for their work, watch over the many merchant and traveler's carts that sit in front. Towards the east you can hear a low chanting combined with the murmur of deep discussion from those who visit the Psion Center.  A wooden sign, a street lantern, and an open sturdy wooden door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* east* south* southwest* west*.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, and a rosewood sign are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Trade Way.]

[Trade Way.]

From the city gate to the west, Trade Way continues eastward towards the busy Merchant district, past Joyeusse's Shop. The air is thick with the scent of fresh flowers. Wagons filled with goods bound for sale trundle past, their drivers hopeful of the anticipated profits. Eager young warriors venture towards the west gate and the dangers beyond. Travelers from Rathan to the northwest, and the Trade Route to the south, converge at Spur's west gate. Guards posted on the ground give those seeking to enter the city a cursory once-over. [West Spur Road.]

[West Spur Road.]

Just to the north, the roadway curves gently around a bend in a large river that flows towards the southeast. An enormous smooth round rock splits off a small eddy from the main current resulting a deep, clear pool by the eastern side of the road. The cool calm water catches the reflection of the white snowcapped mountain range further up the valley while the river rushes past towards Spur. Five fishermen recline on folding chairs or against rocks, tethered by the silvery lines of their poles to the fishing hole. Each fisherman is spread evenly around the pool as if held apart by some invisible barrier as they eye the large shadowy fish shapes finning effortlessly against the mild current in the eddy.

You follow Binx north...

[Silver River Bridge.]

Mismatched mortar colors and varying types and cuts of the stone show the extent of the reconstruction made by quick working masons. A few proud workers chiseled their initials and the date into their handiwork, most reading the date of Rinannimas, 6th month, 61st day, year 313. Bright banners flutter in the breeze on both sides of the bridge as if in celebration of it's victory over both the river's truculence and sabotage.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Loden the Noble Hithual, Haberthan the Hithual, Phannah the Noble Human (holding a glowing delicately engraved moonsilver lamp), Panick the Noble Drag-al, Bethany the Noble Psycian, Kalann the Noble Penthanian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Vartac the Noble Secian, Dhameon the Human, Maren the Usil Elf, Binx the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground and holding a glowing lightning bug on a string), and Mazzar the Noble Penthanian.
Obvious paths: north south*.

You follow Binx north...

[Silver River Bridge.]

A massive stone bridge spans a raging grey tinted river as it runs it's course towards the southeast. The mud around the bridge footings has been churned by wheels of quarry wagons, tracks of sleds bearing block and tackle, shod hooves of draft beasts and booted feet of masons and bridge workers. The newer parts of the huge bridge are obvious due to the contrast in colors of mortar and rock. Bright banners snap briskly in the wind from both ends of the bridge.  A broken wooden wagon is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Loden the Noble Hithual, Haberthan the Hithual, Phannah the Noble Human (holding a glowing delicately engraved moonsilver lamp), Panick the Noble Drag-al, Bethany the Noble Psycian, Kalann the Noble Penthanian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Vartac the Noble Secian, Dhameon the Human, Maren the Usil Elf, Binx the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground and holding a glowing lightning bug on a string), and Mazzar the Noble Penthanian.

Panick swishes her tail.

You follow Binx northwest...

[North Bridge Trail.]

Withstanding seasonal floods and constant traffic, the durable road shows how affective good design and competent construction can be. It travels a hand paved berm straight to an imposing grey stone bridge to the southeast. The pilons of the bridge are cloaked in river mist as the raging river sweeps by. Only the brightness of the fluttering flags that top the spans stand out sharply.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Loden the Noble Hithual, Haberthan the Hithual, Phannah the Noble Human (holding a glowing delicately engraved moonsilver lamp), Panick the Noble Drag-al, Bethany the Noble Psycian, Kalann the Noble Penthanian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Vartac the Noble Secian, Dhameon the Human, Maren the Usil Elf, Binx the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground and holding a glowing lightning bug on a string), and Mazzar the Noble Penthanian.

[North Bridge Trail.]

A brown and white osprey soars above the raging river, scanning the water for a meal. Suddenly, it dives down to the surface and snatches a rather large trout from the water. The trout wriggles helplessly in the large birds grip as it is carried off to a nest of sticks and twigs high in the distant treetops.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Loden the Noble Hithual, Haberthan the Hithual, Phannah the Noble Human (holding a glowing delicately engraved moonsilver lamp), Panick the Noble Drag-al, Bethany the Noble Psycian, Kalann the Noble Penthanian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Vartac the Noble Secian, Dhameon the Human, Maren the Usil Elf, Binx the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground and holding a glowing lightning bug on a string), and Mazzar the Noble Penthanian.

You follow Binx west...

[North Bridge Trail.]

On the northern edge of the road stands a tall, flat rock. Chipped into the shape of a pillar and abraded to smoothness, it bears the stamped surveyor's mark of the road's builder. The mark's grooved letters are filled with sand and dust and obscured from age, but the arrows delineating north, south, east and west are clear and easy to read. The rest of the stamp is undecipherable and lends mystery to the road's origin.

This area is illuminated.

You follow Binx west...

[North Bridge Trail.]

Boulders stacked in pyramids contained by large timbers stand mutely to the side of the roadway next to an impromptu dump of broken tools, wooden stakes and empty buckets lined with mortar. Deeply grooved sled tracks lead to the east towards the bridge from this part of the road where the flatness of the valley was best suited for the staging area during the bridge's reconstruction. Smooth rectangles of tent foundations still mark their location in a semi circle around a blackened fire ring where the workers and their supervisors lived during it's rebuilding.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Loden the Noble Hithual, Haberthan the Hithual, Phannah the Noble Human (holding a glowing delicately engraved moonsilver lamp), Panick the Noble Drag-al, Bethany the Noble Psycian, Kalann the Noble Penthanian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Vartac the Noble Secian, Dhameon the Human, Maren the Usil Elf, Binx the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground and holding a glowing lightning bug on a string), and Mazzar the Noble Penthanian.

You follow Binx west...

[North Bridge Trail.]

The decaying remains of the bridge workers camp sprawls across this flat valley. To house their draft beasts, the workers constructed small stalls and shelters from rickety boards nailed quixotically to the standing trees. Three brass ring topped posts lie sunk into the grasslands turf, to the south, which was most likely used for tethering grazing animals. Between the posts is a rough stone trough that is filled automatically with water by a rickety mechanical wind mill, whirling lazily in the breeze.

This area is illuminated.

You follow Binx northwest...

[North Bridge Trail.]

Water loving trees hug the river's course through the low lying valley. Giant beech and huge alders vie for the valuable sodden shoreline and shade the understory bushes and ferns from direct sunlight. The result is a lushly green, verdant forest that obscures the river from the view on the road, though the hiss of rushing water reveals it's course.

This area is illuminated.

You follow Binx west...

[North Bridge Trail.]

Running parallel to the road is a smooth rock lined trench that channels the road's run-off during rainstorms. This flat part of the road that follows the valley floor would be prone to turn into a muddy bog and therefore a hazard to most caravans and their pack animals. Anticipating this event, the road's engineers built drains into the lower side of the road that carry the runoff into the culvert, which carries it harmlessly down to the low end of the valley.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Loden the Noble Hithual, Haberthan the Hithual, Phannah the Noble Human (holding a glowing delicately engraved moonsilver lamp), Panick the Noble Drag-al, Bethany the Noble Psycian, Kalann the Noble Penthanian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Vartac the Noble Secian, Dhameon the Human, Maren the Usil Elf, Binx the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground and holding a glowing lightning bug on a string), and Mazzar the Noble Penthanian.

[North Bridge Trail.]

With the care and attention to detail rarely given to a mundane project such as a road, the engineers foresaw potential hazards and built the solutions into their finished project. Tracking the southern, downhill side of the road is a stone lined trough meant to solve any flooding or mud related issues.

[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road passes through a small secluded valley. Riverlets and streams trickle down the rock faces adding harmony to a distant river's melody.

[North Bridge Trail.]

The road crests the top of hill overlooking the sweeping grasslands of the river valley. [North Bridge Trail.]

White barked birch trees populate the moist valleys that drain into the river to the southeast as the merchant road passes nearby. The tall vertical trees reach to the sky in a beautiful dance reminiscent of dancers waving their arms gracefully to some unheard rhythm. The grain-laden grasses sway in accompaniment, and the tinkling waterfalls and babbling creeks beat like odd syncopated patterns onto the rocks.

[North Bridge Trail.]

The roadway takes advantage of a cut in the hill to negotiate a tumbled cliff face. At the top of the hill is a high, flat, steppe grassland, and at the bottom is the edge of the open range. At one point, the road narrows to cross a small stream. Very little mud gathers in the shallows of the stream and the pebbles and rocks glitter like gold as the wagon wheels churn the gravel.
