[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant roads widens as it travels another grass swept plateau. The mountain range fills the northern skyline in stark detail. Huge snow capped peaks and rough faced cliffs are close enough to see the individual boulders, waterfalls, and haphazard game trails. Much higher up the great mountainsides a line where trees stop growing gives testament to the altitude. The air is cool.

[North Bridge Trail.]

The grassland plateau is embraced by a stand of dark green oak trees so thick that little light passes through the profusion of their many lobed leaves. The forest is ancient and the trunks of the trees bare witness to fires, lightning strikes and the attacks of insects. Large gout-like burls disfigure some of the wide, grey trunks which have grown quietly next to the road for hundreds of years.

[North Bridge Trail.]

Crunching loudly on the road is a ankle high deposit of acorn hulls and their discarded caps. Quick footed grey squirrels dash across the road, or above on the high intertwined branches of the stately oaks, with the highly coveted acorns grasped firmly in their teeth. The squirrels flash their tails at each other in some unknown signal as traffic passes on the road.  A pile of empty acorn caps is here.

[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road makes a wide turn as it passes through the thick oak forest. A tiny meadow with a murmuring creek is the only open spot in sight. Bright wildflowers and fragrant mosses crowd around a sparkling jewel of a pond while the huge oaks stand like sentinels around the edges. A spotted fawn and its doe-eyed mother drink cautiously, swishing their white edged tails quickly.

[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road follows a bumpy path through the oak forest. Each stately old tree has added a few feet to it's girth since the road was first surveyed and constructed hundreds of years ago. Their roots have plied across the road, upending it's hand laid foundation and hand pounded bed. Several large knees of the oak's roots have leveraged up the edges of the road, hindering all wagons' passage and threatening to break spokes and axles.

This area is illuminated.

[North Bridge Trail.]

Off to the side of the road, perhaps a hundred feet away, stands an enormous tree that commands the attention of all who pass this direction. It's offspring populate the plateau for miles in both directions. At one time, the tree must have stood alone on the prairie soil and dropped acorns year after year until one tree became a huge forest of oaks.

[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road takes a large bend as it travels through the dark woodland. Venerable, wide-trunked oaks line the merchant road and the trunks of the closest ones have been marked by the passage of thousands of travelers and adventurers. Some have carved their initials, some, a picture of loved ones or body parts of odd proportions, and some, the date they passed by.

[North Bridge Trail.]

The high steppe grasslands yields to a green wall of oak trees to the southeast. The oak forest is very old, the greying trunks of the behemoths are cracked and split. The road immediately darkens under the canopy of the green leaves. Pale green bracken ferns grow tall in the eternal twilight shade. Flat, yellow capped mushrooms and rippled shelf fungi sprout from the fallen trees. The pleasant aroma of healthy decomposing leaves fills the air.

[Twin Creeks Crossing.]

Hand pounded concrete pipes, half circle in shape, channel two small streams under the chinked rock and gravel road-bed. The icy spring water bubbles down the hill and glides over a sheet of shorn granite until it fills a crystal clear pool at the bottom, far below the road. The pool's overflow creates a single clear stream that meanders towards the ancient oak forest.

[Twin Creeks Crossing.]

To the southeast, two streams trickle from the north and pass directly under the roadbed. The twin streams combine as they travel down the hill to make a picture-perfect waterfall rimmed by delicate maidenhair ferns and bright green moss. The little riverlet from the pool then flows into an ancient oak forest further southeast.

[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road swerves around a rock strewn hill. Several ancient oak trees grow in solitary wonder on the south side of the hill. Dead fall and broken branches cover the hollow and is home for a family of thick furred marmots. The dark brown colored rodents stare out of the dark recesses of the dead branches with shiny black eyes. A brace of buck-toothed, adolescent marmots scramble for cover as the shrill cry of a hawk sounds further up the mountain.

This area is illuminated.

[North Bridge Trail.]

Thicker stalked grasses grow here on this high plateau where the air is rarified and rain spills quickly down the small rocky gullies. A few staunch oaks grow alone or in groups of one or two, their roots exposed where they cling to the rocky soil for sustenance. Thin, scraggly junipers suck up what little moisture the soil does manage to hold. The merchant road placidly passes by, untouched by time in the dry environment.

[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road swerves around a rock strewn hill. Several ancient oak trees grow in solitary wonder on the south side of the hill. Dead fall and broken branches cover the hollow and is home for a family of thick furred marmots. [North Bridge Trail.]

Thicker stalked grasses grow here on this high plateau where the air is rarified and rain spills quickly down the small rocky gullies. A few staunch oaks grow alone or in groups of one or two, their roots exposed where they cling to the rocky soil for sustenance. Thin, scraggly junipers suck up what little moisture the soil does manage to hold. The merchant road placidly passes by, untouched by time in the dry environment.

[North Bridge Trail.]

Bright green trees and healthy bushes stand out sporadically on the dusty steppe. The little spring fed islands are surrounded by the blue-green grasses that thrive here. All manner of beasts are drawn to the springs and the protection they offer. Bright blue scrub jays chatter noisily among themselves as they dart and swerve in accomplished aerial feats pursuing their winged insect meals. A small herd of wary jackrabbits stop munching the grass to turn their white ears towards the merchant road. The nearest jack to the road stands on his hind legs and tests the air for any scent of their many predators.

[North Bridge Trail.]

[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road follows the path of least resistance through the broken, rocky, higher foothills. Each incline and decline in the road is fixed to an agreeable grade for most wagons and sleds.

[North Bridge Trail.]

[North Bridge Trail.]

[Tarath Fault.]

The sandy soil of the steppe has been ripped away to reveal its intimate underpinnings.  The matted roots of the prairie grasses desperately hold into what little dirt they can while below in wide layers, the rocks and dirt tell the story of the plateau and the surrounding foothills. Each straition varies in texture, composition and color. They are an open book for those with the specific knowledge to read it.

[Tarath Fault.]

The merchant road threads through bottom of the small, narrow valley. Sheer granite walls block the view from the well traveled road to either side and above, only a narrow ray of sky testifies to the time of day. The engineers set a route as far as possible from the broken stones in the center of the valley and, by luck or design, this foresight has saved the road-bed from constant reconstruction. Small cracks run parallel to the road, but none have broken through the thick layers of sand and stone.

This area is illuminated.

[Tarath Fault.]

One layer of rock in the steep walls has eroded faster then the harder granite or bedrock above and below it. Soft sandstone has been stripped away to form an arch in the valley wall ... a concave indention that goes for hundreds of feet in both directions.  Within the hardened sediment left ages ago upon the land are treasures beyond value: fossilized shells by the thousands, in all sizes, shapes and colors.  A sandstone blue scaled fish fossil, a dusty green spiral leaf fossil, and a multi toothed jaw bone fossil are here.

[Tarath Fault.]

The momentous forces that have wrought this valley still press upon the land and have done so for eons.  The walls of the valley are sheer and steep, and untouched by the raging waters of river or stream.  As if in testimony to the power of the forces that move the land, a huge dark boulder sits off to the side of the road. It is hewn in half like a sliced melon.  One part sits 20 feet north along the break in the rocks from the other part.

The earth's upheaval has created this long and narrow fissure. The bottom of the gap is strewn with broken rock and the air hangs heavy with dust. Towering above you, the precarious walls shudder and occasionally drop a smattering of debris at your feet. 

This area is illuminated.

[The Silver Strand.]

This newly constructed road begins the climb to the mountain peaks as a vein from the main Rathan-Fort Tarath artery. Following the steep incline of the mountain's side, this twisting path travels its way to the opposite side of the City of Rathan. High above in that part of the mountain, a single silver-spired tower peaks through the misty mountain air and glistens slightly.

[The Silver Strand.]

The roadway straightens out to the west but continues its incline along the base of the mountain. The walls of Fort Tarath stand tall between the walls of the gorge almost as if daring an army to try and breech them. Large piles of blackened rubble, the product of the roadway excavation, fill the narrow valley between the road edge and the mountain to the south.

[The Silver Strand.]

Small shrubs cling to the mountain side above the roadway, helping to sway the effects of erosion and the buffeting winds. [The Silver Strand.]

High above the mountain base the roadway makes its climb toward the peak. Down below the cliff falls off suddenly into the valley. The sheer drop from the edge would crush even the largest animal on the boulders below. Wind blows up from the valley floor and down from the cliffs above, tugging at clothing, packs and living beings alike.

[Ilmand's Tower, Ground Floor.]

A mass of white polished marble makes up the floor and ceiling of this cylindrical ground floor. Dark purple walls enclose the tower, inclining slightly as they rise up to meet the ceiling. The entire ground floor is open, the rear wall completely visible and swirling with different purple hues. A glimmer of silver can be seen rising through the ceiling in the northwest.  An open silver-trimmed purple crystal gate is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Loden the Noble Hithual, Haberthan the Hithual, Phannah the Noble Human, Panick the Noble Drag-al, Bethany the Noble Psycian, Kalann the Noble Penthanian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Vartac the Noble Secian (holding a glowing opal tipped ebony staff of mages), Dhameon the Human, Maren the Usil Elf, Binx the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground and holding a glowing lightning bug on a string), and Mazzar the Noble Penthanian.

[Ilmand's Tower, Ground Floor.]

The center of the tower boasts a huge silver scarab etched into the floor. The scarabs wings are stretched out to either side, almost touching the far walls of the tower. Massive purple diamonds have been set into the etching throughout the scarab's wings. The diamonds have been smoothed and leveled with the surface of the floor. 

This room is illuminated.

[Laboratory and Experiment Area.]

Long tables filled with various magickal devices, scrolls and containers of strange items line the far corner walls forming an "L". Powerful magickal energy flashes through the air every so often, the reddish-blue bolts dancing off the walls, ceiling and floor. [Barren beach.]

The black sands of this beach give mute testimony to the volcanic origins of this island. The ocean to the south and west sends waves crashing against the shore. Overhead, a lone gull cries in the still air.  A glowing white archway, a corroded iron axe, a corroded iron axe, a corroded iron axe, a tiny black waitress dress, a tiny black waitress dress, and an empty glass vial are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Loden the Noble Hithual, Haberthan the Hithual, Phannah the Noble Human, Panick the Noble Drag-al, Bethany the Noble Psycian, Kalann the Noble Penthanian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Vartac the Noble Secian, Dhameon the Human, Maren the Usil Elf, Binx the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground and holding a glowing lightning bug on a string), and Mazzar the Noble Penthanian.
Obvious paths: north northeast east northwest.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, an open blackened bronze coffer, an open stainless steel coffer, an open painted gold coffer, an open gold-trimmed titanium box, an open blackened brass box, an open scorched bronze box, an open rusting gold box, and a damaged smooth pommeled carbide long sword are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Loden the Noble Hithual, Haberthan the Hithual, Aradeia the Leuian (seated), Phannah the Noble Penthanian, Panick the Noble Drag-al, Bethany the Noble Psycian, Rev the Noble Hithual, Kalann the Noble Penthanian, Anyah the Human, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Vartac the Noble Secian, Dhameon the Human, Maren the Usil Elf, Binx the Secian (holding a glowing lightning bug on a string), and Mazzar the Noble Penthanian.

[Town Square.]

Commercial buildings flank Town Square to the west and south of this corner. Imposing buildings stand stiffly to your west, while those to the south have a slightly seedy look about them.  The door to the west has a freshly painted sign over it,  "Under New Management."  A closed tan weathered pine door, a large doorway, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southwest*.

>[Knowledge Path.]

Before you stands a magnificent white marble temple dedicated to Odarous, the god of chivalry. Ten giant steps made of the same gleaming marble lead up to the temple entrance. Two large statues stand at the base of the stairs, also carved of breath-taking marble. One is a warrior bearing a massive sword and a large shield. The other is a cleric with an amulet bearing the mark of Odarous in one hand and a large mace in the other.  Some gleaming white marble stairs, a polished white marble statue, a polished white marble statue, and a street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: northeast* southwest*.
sw
sw
>[Knowledge Path.]

Knowledge Path heads out of the bustling Town Square and moves southwest towards the District of Magick and Rehas Way. Mixed with the robed mages that move southwest are merchants, customers and thieves alike. Moving quickly, especially with a full purse, is your best bet along this path.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.
sw
[Knowledge Path.]

Several members of the various mage orders of Spur and well-dressed shoppers seeking rarities travel along Knowledge's Path to and from the District of Magick. The district is the place to find the most talented artisans and craftiest merchants in Spur. It is also home to the mages of the non-elemental order.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.
[Knowledge Path.]

A heated discussion breaks out briefly between members of opposing orders of magick. The presence of the city guard rapidly brings an end to the exchange before the verbal debate over power and skill turns into a demonstration.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.
[Knowledge Path.]

Knowledge Path terminates here at the gateway to the Magick District. In respect to the demands of the various religious and guild leaders, magick is kept as far from them as possible. A city plagued by rioting mage haters is the last thing Spur needs.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast*.
go gate
>[Magick Lane & Rehas Way.]

You are just inside the gateway between the Magick District and the Town Square. These gates stand open at all hours of the day or night. An otherwise unremarkable door is glorified by the sign of the city's healer posted beside it.  A wooden door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: south* west*.
s
s
>[Magick Lane.]

A massive circular stone platform stands to the side of Magick Lane, strangely entrancing runes carved on every inch of its sides. The symbol of the god Sa, a golden Dragon, fills the space along the top. Raw power and magick seem to flow from the platform, making the air around it crackle with energy. A small sign stands next to the platform with a single word written upon it.  A rune covered platform, a floating blue ruby staircase leading down, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
s
s
>[Magick Lane.]

A low slung building resides on the west side of the street. Chanting can be heard from within.  Occasionally a few sparks rise into the sky, or some unwarranted raindrops begin, but they quickly are quelled. A large pair of wooden doors, their surface carved with rune symbols grace the entrance.  A street lantern and some open rune-etched wooden doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Magick Lane.]

A squat ugly little shack stands somber on the eastern side of this well swept lane. The occasional high pitched cackle sounds out from the shack, garnering strange looks from all who pass by. A mysterious gothic structure rises up on the opposite side of the street, the occasional explosion thundering out from within its doors, followed by muffled curses and breaking glass.  An open thick iron door, a closed ugly rotting door, a rotting oak sign, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Magick Lane.]

A small sign hangs from above the door of the well-kept store before you, telling you that it is a rune shop. The occasional bright flash of light from inside the store suggests all kinds of strange and rare magicks are being cast inside! Those who walk past you glance at the rune shop warily and hurry to get past it as quickly as possible. A small sign hangs from the doorknob of the store that reads "Flerians not allowed!"  An intricately carved oak door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

[Temple Sa.]

After the world abruptly shifts around you, you stand in the entrance hall to the temple of Sa. On the ceiling, a massive golden Dragon spreads its wings and flies above you. Every one of the golden scales of the Dragon shimmer brightly, lighting the entire temple in an incredible golden aura. You notice a few queasy followers who look a bit green after teleporting.  A floating blue ruby staircase leading up is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east* south*.

You fall 10 feet!
You land unharmed.

>[Temple Sa, Rune Chamber.]

A wave of mystical power can be felt upon entering this chamber. The very air crackles with magickal energy. Several clerics in robes of brilliant blues and golds stand casually around the chamber engaged in quiet conversations as they patiently await their turn to receive or renew one of Sa's holy runes. An elderly priestess stands beside a glowing crystal device at the heart of the chamber. The priestess smiles as she presses a golden tube upon the arm of the next person in line, all the while giving a wordy lecture on the importance of magick on Aradath.  A tall rune-etched crystal podium is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: west*.

[Temple Sa.]

The air around you crackles as you enter the central chamber of the temple. Strongly charged with energy, a massive altar with the symbol of Sa carved upon the top sits in the center of the chamber. When the build-up becomes strong enough, small bolts of lightning rapidly circle the altar. Feverish drawings of rune symbols blanket the walls from floor to ceiling in frantic crimson patterns.  A rune-inscribed ruby altar, a large dragon etched crystal offering bowl, a glowing blue ruby orb on a gold pedestal, a blue vellum treatise on Saian dogma, and a dragon topped ivory fountain are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* east* west*.
e
>[Temple Sa.]

Massive bookshelves line every conceivable inch of wall within this gigantic chamber. Although a few desks are scattered about, the collection of books has left little room for anything else. Most of the books are open to the public for reading and study, while others are kept locked in vaults for use by only the most powerful mages. Anyone else attempting to read them would surely go insane.  An open giant glass case of Saian artifacts is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east* west*.
e
>[Temple Sa.]

From this small office the Regent of Sa commands the spiritual side of the majority of the magick users in the city. While many mages believe they owe allegiance to their magick first and their god second, the Regent serves to remind them which is most important. A small desk sits in the center of the room with an ornate chair behind it.  A small desk and a beautiful mahogany chair are here.

[Magick Lane.]

A massive circular stone platform stands to the side of Magick Lane, strangely entrancing runes carved on every inch of its sides. The symbol of the god Sa, a golden Dragon, fills the space along the top. Raw power and magick seem to flow from the platform, making the air around it crackle with energy. A small sign stands next to the platform with a single word written upon it.  A rune covered platform, a floating blue ruby staircase leading down, and a street lantern are here.

[Magick Lane.]

A low slung building resides on the west side of the street. Chanting can be heard from within.  Occasionally a few sparks rise into the sky, or some unwarranted raindrops begin, but they quickly are quelled. A large pair of wooden doors, their surface carved with rune symbols grace the entrance.  A street lantern and some open rune-etched wooden doors are here.

>[Magick Lane.]

A squat ugly little shack stands somber on the eastern side of this well swept lane. The occasional high pitched cackle sounds out from the shack, garnering strange looks from all who pass by. A mysterious gothic structure rises up on the opposite side of the street, the occasional explosion thundering out from within its doors, followed by muffled curses and breaking glass.  An open thick iron door, a closed ugly rotting door, a rotting oak sign, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
s
>[Magick Lane.]

A small sign hangs from above the door of the well-kept store before you, telling you that it is a rune shop. The occasional bright flash of light from inside the store suggests all kinds of strange and rare magicks are being cast inside! Those who walk past you glance at the rune shop warily and hurry to get past it as quickly as possible. A small sign hangs from the doorknob of the store that reads "Flerians not allowed!"  An intricately carved oak door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
s
>[Magick Lane.]

A small garden of strange plants and spices grows before a small store. The aromas from the objects planted within the garden are intoxicating; they tug at your senses in a confusing attack of reactions. You feel as if you want to sneeze, cough, breathe in and breathe out all at the same time. A stone path cuts through the center of the garden leading to the front door of the shop.  A small wooden door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st city guard mage.

>[Herbalist.]

Dried, cooked, boiled and washed, different herbs sit in boxes upon the counter with prices and information telling of what magical quality the herb or leaf possesses. The smells from the plants of the herbalist seem to have seeped into the walls and ceiling of the small store, everything in the store smells of spice. How anyone could bear to stay in this shop and not have their allergies drive them slowly insane, you can only wonder.  A weathered wooden sign and a small wooden door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, an open blackened bronze coffer, an open stainless steel coffer, an open painted gold coffer, an open gold-trimmed titanium box, an open blackened brass box, an open scorched bronze box, an open rusting gold box, and a damaged smooth pommeled carbide long sword are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Haberthan the Hithual, Terlus the Noble Human, Aradeia the Leuian (seated), Phannah the Noble Penthanian (seated), Nyoko the Drake, Panick the Noble Drag-al, Muthulas the Leuian, Dac the Noble Leuian, Bethany the Noble Psycian, Rev the Noble Hithual, Cleric the Noble Leuian, Stanrar the Noble Human, Kalann the Noble Penthanian, Anyah the Human (holding a lantern), Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Vartac the Noble Secian, Dhameon the Human, Maren the Usil Elf, Binx the Secian (holding a glowing lightning bug on a string), and Mazzar the Noble Penthanian.

[Town Square.]

Two elegant buildings, one to the north and one to the west, stand on either side of a quickly degrading road. Nattily dressed patrons of the two establishments hurry to their destination, not pausing for fear of being robbed, or worse. To the northwest the houses steadily become more decrepit. A dark pallor of smoky air hangs heavily over the area.  A street lantern and a heavy mahogany door are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Haberthan the Hithual, Phannah the Noble Penthanian, Muthulas the Leuian, Ying the Drake, Ceresina the Noble Secian, Rev the Noble Hithual, Cleric the Noble Leuian, Anyah the Human (holding a lantern), Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Vartac the Noble Secian, and Dhameon the Human (holding a flaming star of Psycia patterned cigarette).

[Spur Gateway.]

Travelers from Rathan to the northwest, and the Trade Route to the south, converge at Spur's west gate. Guards posted on the ground give those seeking to enter the city a cursory once-over. A grate in the ground loosens mud from wagon wheels and hooves before they pass through the gate, helping to keep the streets of Spur fairly clean. [West Spur Road.]

From the west spans a dark green forest of Sycamore and Beech trees that soak in the moister parts of the lower river valley. [West Spur Road.]

A rickety criss-crossed rough beam fence pens the grazing of black and white cows whose ponderous forms are barely visible through the tall grass on either side of the road. To the north, the soft, undulating grassland floor of the wide valley succumbs to the rolling foothills, which in turn delineates the imposing outline of a vista-spanning mountain range. Many a traveler has witnessed this idyllic vantage point and has been drawn on to follow the road that travels into the heart of the mountains.

This area is illuminated.

[West Spur Road.]

The road diverts around a small pool of murky water that lies to the north. A confusion of hoof prints muddies the shoreline where the placid bovines have come to water themselves. The pool is damned by a small hillock which allows no drainage so the pool remains stagnant. The mountains to the north reflect in perfectly upside-down symmetry on the still pond's surface, only wavering slightly in concentric circles to the deft touch of small insects.

This area is illuminated.

[West Spur Road.]

The travel-worn road dips and curves around the low lying foothills. Each pass over the top of hillsides presents a new view of the mountain range. Each dip into small valleys reveal minute eco-systems that exist in each wagon wheel rut where water collects. Splayed avion tracks dot the dried mud in random order permanently recording the hunters conquest of lesser things from the mud and moss.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Haberthan the Hithual, Phannah the Noble Penthanian, Ceresina the Noble Secian, Cleric the Noble Leuian, Anyah the Human (holding a lantern), Vartac the Noble Secian, and Dhameon the Human (holding a flaming star of Psycia patterned cigarette).
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest.

You follow Dhameon northwest...

[West Spur Road.]

Aged and splintered into the vague circular shape, a decaying wagon wheel is left to rot in the grass by the roadside. Their roots protectively sheltered from the weather, idiosyntric sprouts of taller grasses thrive haphazardly inside the wheel. Several tiny holes top small pyramids of sandy debris, where a few red fire ants scout their wagon-wheel domain for fodder.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Haberthan the Hithual, Phannah the Noble Penthanian, Ceresina the Noble Secian, Cleric the Noble Leuian, Anyah the Human (holding a lantern), Vartac the Noble Secian, and Dhameon the Human (holding a flaming star of Psycia patterned cigarette).
Obvious paths: southeast* west.

You follow Dhameon west...

[West Spur Road.]

As the road bends around a curve, ruts left by merchant's wagons cut so deeply into the mud that all wheeled vehicles are forced to follow the set path. Four loaded wagons of a merchants caravan stand idle as one larger than standard wagon skitters along the path. The buckboard's frame groans and strains to keep it inline while the driver attempts to negotiate the turn. Four dark maned, matched mules balk at the noise behind them, and stomp nervously over the deep ruts. The liveried caravan guards attempt to haul the mules forward, further adding to the mules stubborn refusal to move.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Haberthan the Hithual, Phannah the Noble Penthanian, Ceresina the Noble Secian, Cleric the Noble Leuian, Anyah the Human (holding a lantern), Vartac the Noble Secian, and Dhameon the Human (holding a flaming star of Psycia patterned cigarette).
Obvious paths: east* northwest.

You follow Dhameon northwest...

[West Spur Road.]

The road charges across a flat valley through waving stalks of grain with coppery tinted seeds. Around the northern edge grows a row of huge cypress trees with trunks that measure eight feet across. Debris from the trees' self-trimming mats the taller grasses into an impenetrable wall. The cypresses produce the necessary windbreak for the field to bear the heavy headed grain.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Haberthan the Hithual, Phannah the Noble Penthanian, Ceresina the Noble Secian, Cleric the Noble Leuian, Anyah the Human (holding a lantern), Vartac the Noble Secian, and Dhameon the Human (holding a flaming star of Psycia patterned cigarette).

You follow Dhameon northwest...

[West Spur Road.]

The worn merchants road travels the southern side of a low hill in one wide arc. The broad path is slightly banked to accomodate for the turn and incline. On the exposed side of the road, the sturdy road-bed is exposed to the elements and yet has remained solid. A neatly kept plank house with a stone well and fenced paddock overlooks grain fields to the southeast.

[West Spur Road.]

Broadening to fill the lee of a wide valley, the roadway passes by several temporary campsites where caravans have bolstered the existing comforts for their temporary encampments. Neat stacks of foraged sticks and axe-hewn firewood sit adjacent to the blackened rocks of two impromptu fire rings. Freshly dug midden pits waft clues to the camp's frequent use into the clean mountain air.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Haberthan the Hithual, Phannah the Noble Penthanian, Ceresina the Noble Secian, Cleric the Noble Leuian, Anyah the Human (holding a lantern), Vartac the Noble Secian, and Dhameon the Human (holding a flaming star of Psycia patterned cigarette).

You follow Dhameon west...

[West Spur Road.]

Empty wooden crates, broken harnesses, damaged pottery, and the usual byproducts of food preparation fill an impromptu refuse pile adjacent to two campsites. Both two and four legged scavengers ply through the pile, scattering it further and enlarging the boundary. The result is a landmark of incongruous shapes, colors and shadows along the otherwise bland sweep of grasslands through which the roadway travels.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Haberthan the Hithual, Phannah the Noble Penthanian, Ceresina the Noble Secian, Cleric the Noble Leuian, Anyah the Human (holding a lantern), Vartac the Noble Secian, and Dhameon the Human (holding a flaming star of Psycia patterned cigarette).
Obvious paths: east* northwest.

You follow Dhameon northwest...

[West Spur Road.]

Just to the north, the roadway curves gently around a bend in a large river that flows towards the southeast. An enormous smooth round rock splits off a small eddy from the main current resulting a deep, clear pool by the eastern side of the road. The cool calm water catches the reflection of the white snowcapped mountain range further up the valley while the river rushes past towards Spur. Five fishermen recline on folding chairs or against rocks, tethered by the silvery lines of their poles to the fishing hole. Each fisherman is spread evenly around the pool as if held apart by some invisible barrier as they eye the large shadowy fish shapes finning effortlessly against the mild current in the eddy.

This area is illuminated.

[West Spur Road.]

The raging silver-cast river cuts through the grassland and heads southeast. Fishing boats, bearing the crest of the city of Spur, dart around several barges laden with exotic wares to trade in the merchant city. Most bear the purple livery of the city of Rathan, but every so often a ship flying unfamiliar colors can be sighted.

[West Spur Road.]

The metal grey river deposits a sandbar on its western bank near the merchant road, causing a snag of dead logs, branches and floating debris. A cat sized rodent, with long teeth, flat tail and webbed toes peaks briefly over the jumbled tangle of branches before dipping back into the frigid water without a splash.

[West Spur Road.]

Built to withstand the constant flooding of the large river, the roadbed here was constructed 3 feet higher then the rest of the valley floor. The competant engineers extended the berm further northwest until it became the footings of a stalwart rock bridge.

[Silver River Bridge.]

The massive stone bridge expands over the raging river, it's huge pilons buried deep in the river's bottom. Within sight and just downstream, the water rushes past what remains of the old bridge, causing dangerous under-currents. Bright red bouys mark the broken fragments locations and signs tell of the peril. The river pilots earn their pay negotiating this treacherous obstacle.

[Silver River Bridge.]

The huge stone bridge span was built tall to allow the various merchant ships to pass underneath. This amazing height affords a splendid view of the countryside: from the blur of smoky residential air to the southeast, across the verdant grasslands that cover the foothills, to the majestic peaks of the mountain range to the north.

[Silver River Bridge.]

The river surges strongly below the stone span. Even from this height, the noise of the flowing water is near deafening. Two small fishing boats nearly collide as they try to tack between the same set of supports. Only skillful sailing prevents them from hitting each other, or the supports.

[Silver River Bridge.]

In the middle of the stone bridge's span, a carved stone plaque is set into the masonry of the rock wall. Worked black marble bears a likeness of a San Elf and a brief warning describing her and her crimes against the merchants who depend on this bridge for their livelihood.

[Silver River Bridge.]

Mismatched mortar colors and varying types and cuts of the stone show the extent of the reconstruction made by quick working masons. A few proud workers chiseled their initials and the date into their handiwork, most reading the date of Rinannimas, 6th month, 61st day, year 313. Bright banners flutter in the breeze on both sides of the bridge as if in celebration of it's victory over both the river's truculence and sabotage.

[Silver River Bridge.]

A massive stone bridge spans a raging grey tinted river as it runs it's course towards the southeast. The mud around the bridge footings has been churned by wheels of quarry wagons, tracks of sleds bearing block and tackle, shod hooves of draft beasts and booted feet of masons and bridge workers. The newer parts of the huge bridge are obvious due to the contrast in colors of mortar and rock. Bright banners snap briskly in the wind from both ends of the bridge.  A broken wooden wagon is here.

[North Bridge Trail.]

Withstanding seasonal floods and constant traffic, the durable road shows how affective good design and competent construction can be. It travels a hand paved berm straight to an imposing grey stone bridge to the southeast. The pilons of the bridge are cloaked in river mist as the raging river sweeps by. Only the brightness of the fluttering flags that top the spans stand out sharply.

[North Bridge Trail.]

A brown and white osprey soars above the raging river, scanning the water for a meal. Suddenly, it dives down to the surface and snatches a rather large trout from the water. The trout wriggles helplessly in the large birds grip as it is carried off to a nest of sticks and twigs high in the distant treetops.

[North Bridge Trail.]

On the northern edge of the road stands a tall, flat rock. Chipped into the shape of a pillar and abraded to smoothness, it bears the stamped surveyor's mark of the road's builder. The mark's grooved letters are filled with sand and dust and obscured from age, but the arrows delineating north, south, east and west are clear and easy to read. The rest of the stamp is undecipherable and lends mystery to the road's origin.

This area is illuminated.

[North Bridge Trail.]

Boulders stacked in pyramids contained by large timbers stand mutely to the side of the roadway next to an impromptu dump of broken tools, wooden stakes and empty buckets lined with mortar. Deeply grooved sled tracks lead to the east towards the bridge from this part of the road where the flatness of the valley was best suited for the staging area during the bridge's reconstruction. Smooth rectangles of tent foundations still mark their location in a semi circle around a blackened fire ring where the workers and their supervisors lived during it's rebuilding.

[North Bridge Trail.]

The decaying remains of the bridge workers camp sprawls across this flat valley. To house their draft beasts, the workers constructed small stalls and shelters from rickety boards nailed quixotically to the standing trees. Three brass ring topped posts lie sunk into the grasslands turf, to the south, which was most likely used for tethering grazing animals. Between the posts is a rough stone trough that is filled automatically with water by a rickety mechanical wind mill, whirling lazily in the breeze.

[North Bridge Trail.]

Water loving trees hug the river's course through the low lying valley. Giant beech and huge alders vie for the valuable sodden shoreline and shade the understory bushes and ferns from direct sunlight. The result is a lushly green, verdant forest that obscures the river from the view on the road, though the hiss of rushing water reveals it's course.

This area is illuminated.

[North Bridge Trail.]

Running parallel to the road is a smooth rock lined trench that channels the road's run-off during rainstorms. This flat part of the road that follows the valley floor would be prone to turn into a muddy bog and therefore a hazard to most caravans and their pack animals. Anticipating this event, the road's engineers built drains into the lower side of the road that carry the runoff into the culvert, which carries it harmlessly down to the low end of the valley.

This area is illuminated.

[North Bridge Trail.]

With the care and attention to detail rarely given to a mundane project such as a road, the engineers foresaw potential hazards and built the solutions into their finished project. Tracking the southern, downhill side of the road is a stone lined trough meant to solve any flooding or mud related issues.

[North Bridge Trail.]

White barked birch trees populate the moist valleys that drain into the river to the southeast as the merchant road passes nearby. [North Bridge Trail.]

The roadway takes advantage of a cut in the hill to negotiate a tumbled cliff face. At the top of the hill is a high, flat, steppe grassland, and at the bottom is the edge of the open range. At one point, the road narrows to cross a small stream. Very little mud gathers in the shallows of the stream and the pebbles and rocks glitter like gold as the wagon wheels churn the gravel.

[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant roads widens as it travels another grass swept plateau. The mountain range fills the northern skyline in stark detail. Huge snow capped peaks and rough faced cliffs are close enough to see the individual boulders, waterfalls, and haphazard game trails. Much higher up the great mountainsides a line where trees stop growing gives testament to the altitude. The air is cool.

[North Bridge Trail.]

The grassland plateau is embraced by a stand of dark green oak trees so thick that little light passes through the profusion of their many lobed leaves. The forest is ancient and the trunks of the trees bare witness to fires, lightning strikes and the attacks of insects. Large gout-like burls disfigure some of the wide, grey trunks which have grown quietly next to the road for hundreds of years.

[North Bridge Trail.]

Crunching loudly on the road is a ankle high deposit of acorn hulls and their discarded caps. Quick footed grey squirrels dash across the road, or above on the high intertwined branches of the stately oaks, with the highly coveted acorns grasped firmly in their teeth. The squirrels flash their tails at each other in some unknown signal as traffic passes on the road.  A pile of empty acorn caps is here.

A spotted fawn and its doe-eyed mother drink cautiously, swishing their white edged tails quickly.

[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road follows a bumpy path through the oak forest. Each stately old tree has added a few feet to it's girth since the road was first surveyed and constructed hundreds of years ago. Their roots have plied across the road, upending it's hand laid foundation and hand pounded bed. Several large knees of the oak's roots have leveraged up the edges of the road, hindering all wagons' passage and threatening to break spokes and axles.

[North Bridge Trail.]

Off to the side of the road, perhaps a hundred feet away, stands an enormous tree that commands the attention of all who pass this direction. It's offspring populate the plateau for miles in both directions. At one time, the tree must have stood alone on the prairie soil and dropped acorns year after year until one tree became a huge forest of oaks.

[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road takes a large bend as it travels through the dark woodland. Venerable, wide-trunked oaks line the merchant road and the trunks of the closest ones have been marked by the passage of thousands of travelers and adventurers. Some have carved their initials, some, a picture of loved ones or body parts of odd proportions, and some, the date they passed by.

[North Bridge Trail.]

The high steppe grasslands yields to a green wall of oak trees to the southeast. The oak forest is very old, the greying trunks of the behemoths are cracked and split. The road immediately darkens under the canopy of the green leaves. Pale green bracken ferns grow tall in the eternal twilight shade. Flat, yellow capped mushrooms and rippled shelf fungi sprout from the fallen trees. The pleasant aroma of healthy decomposing leaves fills the air.

This area is illuminated.

[Twin Creeks Crossing.]

Hand pounded concrete pipes, half circle in shape, channel two small streams under the chinked rock and gravel road-bed. The icy spring water bubbles down the hill and glides over a sheet of shorn granite until it fills a crystal clear pool at the bottom, far below the road. The pool's overflow creates a single clear stream that meanders towards the ancient oak forest.

[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road swerves around a rock strewn hill. Several ancient oak trees grow in solitary wonder on the south side of the hill. Dead fall and broken branches cover the hollow and is home for a family of thick furred marmots. The dark brown colored rodents stare out of the dark recesses of the dead branches with shiny black eyes. A brace of buck-toothed, adolescent marmots scramble for cover as the shrill cry of a hawk sounds further up the mountain.

[North Bridge Trail.]

Thicker stalked grasses grow here on this high plateau where the air is rarified and rain spills quickly down the small rocky gullies. A few staunch oaks grow alone or in groups of one or two, their roots exposed where they cling to the rocky soil for sustenance. Thin, scraggly junipers suck up what little moisture the soil does manage to hold. The merchant road placidly passes by, untouched by time in the dry environment.

[North Bridge Trail.]

Bright green trees and healthy bushes stand out sporadically on the dusty steppe. The little spring fed islands are surrounded by the blue-green grasses that thrive here. All manner of beasts are drawn to the springs and the protection they offer. Bright blue scrub jays chatter noisily among themselves as they dart and swerve in accomplished aerial feats pursuing their winged insect meals. A small herd of wary jackrabbits stop munching the grass to turn their white ears towards the merchant road. The nearest jack to the road stands on his hind legs and tests the air for any scent of their many predators.

[North Bridge Trail.]

[North Bridge Trail.]

[North Bridge Trail.]

[North Bridge Trail.]

[Tarath Fault.]

The sandy soil of the steppe has been ripped away to reveal its intimate underpinnings.  The matted roots of the prairie grasses desperately hold into what little dirt they can while below in wide layers, the rocks and dirt tell the story of the plateau and the surrounding foothills. Each straition varies in texture, composition and color. They are an open book for those with the specific knowledge to read it.

[Tarath Fault.]

The merchant road threads through bottom of the small, narrow valley. Sheer granite walls block the view from the well traveled road to either side and above, only a narrow ray of sky testifies to the time of day. The engineers set a route as far as possible from the broken stones in the center of the valley and, by luck or design, this foresight has saved the road-bed from constant reconstruction. Small cracks run parallel to the road, but none have broken through the thick layers of sand and stone.

[Tarath Fault.]

Tumbled boulders and landslides fan down from the crumbling walls of the valley. In the more narrow spots, the alluvial fans of debris clog the roadway and the practical merchants and their caravans have had to devise small detours around the bigger obstacles.

[Tarath Fault.]

One layer of rock in the steep walls has eroded faster then the harder granite or bedrock above and below it. Soft sandstone has been stripped away to form an arch in the valley wall ... a concave indention that goes for hundreds of feet in both directions.  Within the hardened sediment left ages ago upon the land are treasures beyond value: fossilized shells by the thousands, in all sizes, shapes and colors.  A sandstone blue scaled fish fossil, a dusty green spiral leaf fossil, and a multi toothed jaw bone fossil are here.

[Tarath Fault.]

The momentous forces that have wrought this valley still press upon the land and have done so for eons. As if in testimony to the power of the forces that move the land, a huge dark boulder sits off to the side of the road. It is hewn in half like a sliced melon.  One part sits 20 feet north along the break in the rocks from the other part.

[The Silver Strand.]

High above the mountain base the roadway makes its climb toward the peak. Down below the cliff falls off suddenly into the valley. The sheer drop from the edge would crush even the largest animal on the boulders below. Wind blows up from the valley floor and down from the cliffs above, tugging at clothing, packs and living beings alike.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Haberthan the Hithual, Phannah the Noble Penthanian, Ceresina the Noble Secian, Cleric the Noble Leuian, Anyah the Human (holding a lantern), Vartac the Noble Secian (holding a glowing opal tipped ebony staff of mages), and Dhameon the Human (holding a flaming star of Psycia patterned cigarette).

[The Silver Strand.]

A ribbon of pure silver stretches out through the billowing clouds toward the peak of the mountain. Each step is like walking on soft carpeting but without any solid underfooting to hold one up. Any movement on the silver strand makes the surface flow like the waves on the ocean, rippling into the distance.

[The Silver Strand.]

The strand twists and stretches and in some parts is not entirely there. Large holes open and close on its surface but without fail passage over these rifts is made without any problems. Above and surrounding the strand, the billowing clouds make up the walls of a silky tunnel, flickering with light and the sounds of rolling thunder every so often. The tunnel leads east to a solid mountain roadway and west into a blur.

[The Silver Strand.]

[Ilmand's Tower, Ground Floor.]

The silver-trim of this delicate stairway shines brightly whenever a light source is brought near. Rising up through the ceiling, this spiraling stairway is the only route to the second floor. Though a lighter shade of purple, the stairway blends almost identically with the surrounding walls of the tower.  A silver-trimmed spiraling crystal stairway is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Firebreath the Noble Drake, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Haberthan the Hithual, Phannah the Noble Penthanian, Ceresina the Noble Secian, Cleric the Noble Leuian, Anyah the Human (holding a lantern), Vartac the Noble Secian, and Dhameon the Human.
Obvious exits: east* southeast* south*.

[Ilmand's Tower, Second Floor.]

Like the first floor, the walls of the second rise up and angle slightly inward from floor to ceiling. Because of this, the area of the second floor is noticeably smaller then that of the first. However everything else is identical such as the deep purple crystal of the walls and the pulsing light from within.  A silver-trimmed spiraling crystal stairway is here.

[Ilmand's Tower, Second Floor.]

A cool breeze blows down from the third floor landing, bringing with it the scents of magickal herbs. The walls glow brightly, the surface totally smooth and cool to the touch. [Ilmand's Tower, Third Floor.]

Strange and wonderful smells assault the senses at the top of the spiral staircase. Odd clicking and the sound of birds singing can be hear all around, though there are no animals or anything else around to make them. This room is illuminated.

[Study and Training Room.]

A row of red velvet padded chairs lines the entire perimeter of the room. Two long tables parallel each other in the center of the room, their carved obsidian tops holding scores of papers, books and parchments. This room is extremely quiet, be it from magickal or nonmagickal means, it is a wonderful place to bury ones face in study.  A swirling magnesium portal is here.

[Laboratory and Experiment Area.]

Long tables filled with various magickal devices, scrolls and containers of strange items line the far corner walls forming an "L". The walls pulse slightly, the purple glow covering almost every item within the room, giving everything a strange purple hue. Powerful magickal energy flashes through the air every so often, the reddish-blue bolts dancing off the walls, ceiling and floor. An odd Thugian sized box rests against the rear wall; piles of crystal, drathain and granite dust lie on the floor.  A glowing white archway is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Firebreath the Noble Drake, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Haberthan the Hithual, Nyoko the Drake, Grad the Thugian, Ying the Drake, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Ceresina the Noble Secian, Rev the Noble Hithual, Cleric the Noble Leuian, Stanrar the Noble Human, Anyah the Human (holding a lantern), Vartac the Noble Secian, Dhameon the Human, and Binx the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground and holding a glowing lightning bug on a string).

l
[Laboratory and Experiment Area.]

Long tables filled with various magickal devices, scrolls and containers of strange items line the far corner walls forming an "L". The walls pulse slightly, the purple glow covering almost every item within the room, giving everything a strange purple hue. Powerful magickal energy flashes through the air every so often, the reddish-blue bolts dancing off the walls, ceiling and floor. >[Antechamber.]

Rough-hewn walls give this area an austere, yet functional feel. A dark, oppressive feeling lingers in the musty air. You feel you are being watched by some supernatural, malevolent being. Several of the banners hanging from the walls bear insignia that match those on the robes of some of the cultists.  An open sturdy wooden door is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: northeast* southwest* northwest*.
nw
>[Meeting room.]

This gathering room is full of wooden benches for the rank and file cultists. At the eastern end of the room, a podium stands on a dais. A large banner with the now-familiar symbol of the cult hangs on the wall behind the podium.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: southeast*.
go ban
>[Secret tunnel.]

A small puddle of water has formed at the southwest end of this secret passageway. Just beyond the puddle, the tunnel ends in a large banner, concealing the tunnel from the view of the people in the room behind it. The tunnel appears to slope gently upwards to the northeast.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: northeast*.
ne
>[Secret tunnel.]

The dark, dank passageway continues onward. A faint acrid smell wafts in from somewhere, and you sense a dark presence close by. You feel a strong desire to hurry onward.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: northeast* southwest*.
ne
>[Secret tunnel.]

The northeastern end of this secret passageway exits to an alcove. A statue stands just beyond the end of the tunnel, concealing it from the view of people in the room beyond. The tunnel slopes slightly downward as it heads off to the southwest.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: southwest*.
go al
>[Dark cult altar]

Mystical chants echo through this area, where the cultists obviously gather to serve their deity.  Their holy symbol is carved on the pulpit in the western corner of the room, while prayer rugs cover the floor. Black candles flicker on the altar by the northwestern wall. Small statuettes stand on pedestals in alcoves lining the side walls. An archway leads southeast.  A blood-stained black marble altar, a darkened ceremonial archway, some rubble, and a small clump of rubble are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.
go ar
>[Cultist passage.]

A cool draft from the archway to the northwest hits you in the face. You hear voices murmuring, almost chanting, beyond the arch. A narrow stairway leads upward, providing an alternate exit from this room.  A darkened ceremonial archway and a narrow staircase are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.
go st
>[Warehouse.]

From the inside, this building looks like a small warehouse. Crates are stacked upon the floor, yet upon closer examination, they appear to be empty. No ordinary warehouse would have such a flow of cultists wandering through it either. You are left with the feeling that there is more to this building than meets the eye. A door leads outside.  An open thick oak door and a hidden staircase are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[Poor quarter.]

Several figures in flowing robes are standing around the door to one of the few new buildings in the poor quarter, seemingly sizing up everyone who passes by. You feel chills running down your spine as they start coldly staring at you. You feel distinctly unwelcome.   An open thick oak door is here.

>[Side street.]

This side street is deeply masked by shadows. It starts to twist and turn as it enters the alleyways behind the houses. The makeshift roofing above seems to cut off what little light might ever filter in. Someone seems to want it dark here.  An open crooked red wooden door is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east west northwest*.
e
e
>[Dismal Lane.]

Dismal Lane continues on a crooked path north and south. A side street branches to the west and is quickly lost in the shadows. A ramshack looking building that seems to be almost leaning sideways stands out on the corner, a small dented sign hangs from above the swinging wooden doors that reads, "Tarnished Tankard Tavern and Inn". From the look of the patrons milling around outside, this is anything but a high class establishment.  A pair of broken swinging wooden doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north south west*.
You cannot move in that direction.
s
>[Dismal Lane.]

Dismal Lane meanders between old decrepit buildings. Some appear to be uninhabited with windows and doors boarded over. Others show signs of life, but are in little better state of repair. Canvas covers broken windows, and doors hang loosely on broken hinges. A gang of young Thugians are picking on a human child, pushing him back and forth. There is neither fear nor anger on the child's face, only dull, apathetic acceptance.  An open blue door and a scented lilac tree are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south.
s
s
s
s
>[Dismal Lane.]

An eagle-emblazoned hostel and a large school house stand out amidst the broken down houses. A small group of children gather around an adolescent boy with the face of an old man. He smirks at the children on their way to school, while his followers openly taunt them. A teacher takes a step toward the boy as if to shoo him away, but thinks better of it and retreats back into the school.  An open door and an open schoolhouse door are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st merchant and the 2nd merchant.
Obvious paths: north* south.
[Dismal Lane.]

The broken and shattered remains of the Temple of Set litter the road and the spot where the temple once stood. Beggars and poor folk stand staring forlornly at the remains. A few make their way through the broken gate, some crying and some showing no emotion at all. Offerings to Set have been placed all around and litter the area.  A broken wooden gate and some stairs are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south west*.
[Dismal Lane.]

A large section of buildings on the west side of the street is now gone. The constant noises of construction and demolition pound away at all hours. The street is immaculately clean save the tons of stones piled along the poor quarter wall. The street stones extend westward, paving the beginnings of a large square shaped area.  A pile of stones is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south southwest west.
[Dank & Dismal.]

Just inside the gate from Town Square, the intersection of Dismal and Dank streets meet into a corner. Whole sections of buildings are being ripped out, demolishing them piece by piece. A couple of beggars incoherently plea for something despite the food they have in their hands.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* southeast west northwest.
se
>[Gateway.]

You are just inside the gateway between the Poor Quarter and Town Square. Beggars line the street while the very shadows seem to move and flicker around you.  An open iron gate is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northwest*.
go gate
>[Low Street.]

Low Street ends at a gate that stands permanently ajar, its mechanism jammed and broken. Set in the massive city walls between Town Square and Spur's Poor Quarter, the gates rickety appearance befits that which lies behind it. Loud and colorful words, mixing with the sound of playing children can be heard from within.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast*.
se
se
se
>[Low Street.]

Potholes and cracks in the road impede travel on this portion of Low Street. Maintenance is not considered a priority, due to the roads distance from the center of the city. Unimpeded by the poor condition of the street, several people gather around a nearby newsstand, reading the latest issue of the Spurian Free Press and discussing politics. Across the street from the newsstand a sign next to a weathered brown wooden door reads, "Spurian Free Press" in large, bold letters.   A street lantern, an open weathered brown wooden door, and a wooden newsstand are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.
se
se
[Low Street.]

A beggar lies in a large pile of trash snoring deeply. His clothing is torn, filthy dirty, and a strong smell of alcohol wafts off of him. Sniffing around in the garbage, a hound looks for any scrap that can be eaten. The pup nudges the beggar and begins to rummage through the trash that he is using for bedding.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.
se
[Low Street.]

Low Street is the thoroughfare that carries people to the northwestern portion of Spur. The traffic along this road leans towards those without any viable economic means. Women who look older then their years, crippled old men and darkly clad shadowy figures all move stoically towards their destination. Only the plodding of worn shoes breaks the dismal silence.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.
[Low Street.]

A darkly clad hoodlum leans against a worn street sign. He eyes those who pass by very carefully and then makes a few gestures into the shadows. All who are forced to travel upon this road have learned to keep one hand on their coin purse, the other on their weapon, and their wits about them.  A faded wooden sign and a glowing street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st street urchin and the 2nd street urchin.
Obvious exits: southeast* northwest*.
[Town Square.]

Two elegant buildings, one to the north and one to the west, stand on either side of a quickly degrading road. Nattily dressed patrons of the two establishments hurry to their destination, not pausing for fear of being robbed, or worse. To the northwest the houses steadily become more decrepit. A dark pallor of smoky air hangs heavily over the area.  A street lantern and a heavy mahogany door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* southeast* south* west* northwest*.
[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, and a rosewood sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lemont the Drag-al (holding a flaming moonsilver oil lamp), Firebreath the Noble Drake, Haberthan the Hithual, Nyoko the Drake, Ceresina the Noble Secian, Rev the Noble Hithual, Cleric the Noble Leuian, Anyah the Human (holding a lantern), Vartac the Noble Secian (holding a glowing opal tipped ebony staff of mages), and Binx the Secian (holding a glowing lightning bug on a string).
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Town Square.]

The elegant Hotel Royale towers above the street, its emerald door sparkling in the light. The patrons that stroll in and out are catered to, doors opened and closed for them, and baggage and packages carried by harried servants. The large Bank of Spur sits on the east side of the square. Its location close to the Royale is not a coincidence. A gold-trimmed door is proof of the success of this branch of the Spurian bank and those who run it.  An elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, open emerald steel door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* southeast* west* northwest*.
go door
>[Bank.]

Two large Thugian guards stand sentinel on each side of the doors to the main branch of the Bank of Spur. Elegant furnishings adorn the office. Polished oak and gold filigree emphasize the wealth that abounds in this establishment. Well-dressed tellers stand ready to help you store your money safely or to reduce your coinage to more manageable form.  An open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, a wooden sign, and a bright wooden sign are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

[HOD Agent.]

You have entered the somber insurance headquarters of the House of the Dead. Richly appointed furnishings indicate that these services are refused by few. [Trade Way & Bazaar Path.]

A path to the north winds its way among various stalls and tents. Some specialty outlets can be found, provided one does not get lost in this maze known as the Bazaar. More permanent structures to the south suggest finer goods as well as increased security.  A street lantern is here.

[Trade Way.]

This well-worn road separates the Bazaar to the north and Market Circle to the south. Only a Thugian could appreciate the layered odors of simmering foodstuffs and shoppers from the Bazaar. Crowds of people push past, some brushing against you. It might be a good idea to keep an eye on your coinpurse.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

You follow Anyah west...

[Trade & Market.]

The buildings of Market Circle stand to the south. It becomes obvious that the area through the arch is a much cleaner marketplace than the bazaar. An inviting eatery stands beside the road, its door open to those weary after a long trip to Spur, as well as those preparing to venture to the great expanses beyond the west gate. A human couple exit the building, arm in arm. A small sign stands beside the intersection.  A sign, an open glossy lacquered oak door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lemont the Drag-al (holding a flaming moonsilver oil lamp), Haberthan the Hithual, Ying the Drake, Cleric the Noble Leuian, Anyah the Human (holding a lantern), and Vartac the Noble Secian (holding a glowing opal tipped ebony staff of mages).

You follow Anyah west...

[Trade Way.]

The throngs of travelers thicken as one heads east along Trade Way. An Anthian plays softly on a strange looking stringed instrument, her melodic voice filling the air. Judging by her clothing, and the number of silvers at her feet, she makes a fine living practicing her craft.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Trade Way.]

Deep grey mists surround a strange pile of rubble that lies south of the road. Occasionally a priest clad in a simple grey robe will wander past the rubble and whisper a short prayer under his breath. The fence running around the rubble is well kept, but the gate which once allowed entrance to this Temple has been chained closed.  A grey iron chained gate, a pile of rubble, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Trade Way.]

From the city gate to the west, Trade Way continues eastward towards the busy Merchant district, past Joyeusse's Shop. The air is thick with the scent of fresh flowers. Wagons filled with goods bound for sale trundle past, their drivers hopeful of the anticipated profits. Eager young warriors venture towards the west gate and the dangers beyond.  An open carved rosewood door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lemont the Drag-al (holding a flaming moonsilver oil lamp), Haberthan the Hithual, Ying the Drake, Cleric the Noble Leuian, Anyah the Human (holding a lantern), and Vartac the Noble Secian (holding a glowing opal tipped ebony staff of mages).
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Anyah west...

[Gateway.]

The relative safety inside Spur is a comfort to those returning from the fields and mountains. To those leaving, a massive wall of defense around the city lies ahead. Archer towers beside the gate overlook the wall, offering a painful welcome to would-be invaders. Several guards on foot patrol pass and disappear behind a thick, bluesteel banded steelwood door. Wall road stretches to the south, a wide passage between the city wall and several large buildings.  An open iron gate, an open thick stone door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lemont the Drag-al (holding a flaming moonsilver oil lamp), Haberthan the Hithual, Ying the Drake, Cleric the Noble Leuian, Anyah the Human (holding a lantern), and Vartac the Noble Secian (holding a glowing opal tipped ebony staff of mages).

You follow Anyah through an open iron gate...

[Spur Gateway.]

Travelers from Rathan to the northwest, and the Trade Route to the south, converge at Spur's west gate. Guards posted on the ground give those seeking to enter the city a cursory once-over. Their lack of interest shows that anyone approaching has already been observed from above for some time. A grate in the ground loosens mud from wagon wheels and hooves before they pass through the gate, helping to keep the streets of Spur fairly clean.  An open giant black iron gate, a giant green oak tree, a small blue pool, a thick oak grate over the pool, and a polished stone marker are here.

This area is illuminated.

[West Spur Road.]

The path is flanked by countless tall oaks, swaying peacefully in the wind. They do their best to hide the sky from view, making it hard to tell night from day at times. [West Spur Road.]

A rickety criss-crossed rough beam fence pens the grazing of black and white cows whose ponderous forms are barely visible through the tall grass on either side of the road. To the north, the soft, undulating grassland floor of the wide valley succumbs to the rolling foothills, which in turn delineates the imposing outline of a vista-spanning mountain range. Many a traveler has witnessed this idyllic vantage point and has been drawn on to follow the road that travels into the heart of the mountains.

[West Spur Road.]

The road diverts around a small pool of murky water that lies to the north. A confusion of hoof prints muddies the shoreline where the placid bovines have come to water themselves. The pool is damned by a small hillock which allows no drainage so the pool remains stagnant. The mountains to the north reflect in perfectly upside-down symmetry on the still pond's surface, only wavering slightly in concentric circles to the deft touch of small insects.

[West Spur Road.]

The travel-worn road dips and curves around the low lying foothills. Each pass over the top of hillsides presents a new view of the mountain range. Each dip into small valleys reveal minute eco-systems that exist in each wagon wheel rut where water collects. Splayed avion tracks dot the dried mud in random order permanently recording the hunters conquest of lesser things from the mud and moss.

[West Spur Road.]

Aged and splintered into the vague circular shape, a decaying wagon wheel is left to rot in the grass by the roadside. Their roots protectively sheltered from the weather, idiosyntric sprouts of taller grasses thrive haphazardly inside the wheel. Several tiny holes top small pyramids of sandy debris, where a few red fire ants scout their wagon-wheel domain for fodder.

[West Spur Road.]

As the road bends around a curve, ruts left by merchant's wagons cut so deeply into the mud that all wheeled vehicles are forced to follow the set path. Four loaded wagons of a merchants caravan stand idle as one larger than standard wagon skitters along the path. The buckboard's frame groans and strains to keep it inline while the driver attempts to negotiate the turn. Four dark maned, matched mules balk at the noise behind them, and stomp nervously over the deep ruts. The liveried caravan guards attempt to haul the mules forward, further adding to the mules stubborn refusal to move.

Debris from the trees' self-trimming mats the taller grasses into an impenetrable wall. The cypresses produce the necessary windbreak for the field to bear the heavy headed grain.

[West Spur Road.]

Empty wooden crates, broken harnesses, damaged pottery, and the usual byproducts of food preparation fill an impromptu refuse pile adjacent to two campsites. Both two and four legged scavengers ply through the pile, scattering it further and enlarging the boundary. The result is a landmark of incongruous shapes, colors and shadows along the otherwise bland sweep of grasslands through which the roadway travels.

[West Spur Road.]

Just to the north, the roadway curves gently around a bend in a large river that flows towards the southeast. An enormous smooth round rock splits off a small eddy from the main current resulting a deep, clear pool by the eastern side of the road. The cool calm water catches the reflection of the white snowcapped mountain range further up the valley while the river rushes past towards Spur. Five fishermen recline on folding chairs or against rocks, tethered by the silvery lines of their poles to the fishing hole. Each fisherman is spread evenly around the pool as if held apart by some invisible barrier as they eye the large shadowy fish shapes finning effortlessly against the mild current in the eddy.

[West Spur Road.]

Built to withstand the constant flooding of the large river, the roadbed here was constructed 3 feet higher then the rest of the valley floor. The competant engineers extended the berm further northwest until it became the footings of a stalwart rock bridge.

[Silver River Bridge.]

The massive stone bridge expands over the raging river, it's huge pilons buried deep in the river's bottom. Within sight and just downstream, the water rushes past what remains of the old bridge, causing dangerous under-currents. Bright red bouys mark the broken fragments locations and signs tell of the peril. The river pilots earn their pay negotiating this treacherous obstacle.

[Silver River Bridge.]

The huge stone bridge span was built tall to allow the various merchant ships to pass underneath. This amazing height affords a splendid view of the countryside: from the blur of smoky residential air to the southeast, across the verdant grasslands that cover the foothills, to the majestic peaks of the mountain range to the north.

[Silver River Bridge.]

The river surges strongly below the stone span. Even from this height, the noise of the flowing water is near deafening. Two small fishing boats nearly collide as they try to tack between the same set of supports. Only skillful sailing prevents them from hitting each other, or the supports.

[Silver River Bridge.]

Mismatched mortar colors and varying types and cuts of the stone show the extent of the reconstruction made by quick working masons. A few proud workers chiseled their initials and the date into their handiwork, most reading the date of Rinannimas, 6th month, 61st day, year 313. Bright banners flutter in the breeze on both sides of the bridge as if in celebration of it's victory over both the river's truculence and sabotage.

[Silver River Bridge.]

[North Bridge Trail.]

Withstanding seasonal floods and constant traffic, the durable road shows how affective good design and competent construction can be. It travels a hand paved berm straight to an imposing grey stone bridge to the southeast. The pilons of the bridge are cloaked in river mist as the raging river sweeps by. Only the brightness of the fluttering flags that top the spans stand out sharply.

[North Bridge Trail.]

A brown and white osprey soars above the raging river, scanning the water for a meal. Suddenly, it dives down to the surface and snatches a rather large trout from the water. The trout wriggles helplessly in the large birds grip as it is carried off to a nest of sticks and twigs high in the distant treetops.

[North Bridge Trail.]

On the northern edge of the road stands a tall, flat rock. Chipped into the shape of a pillar and abraded to smoothness, it bears the stamped surveyor's mark of the road's builder. The mark's grooved letters are filled with sand and dust and obscured from age, but the arrows delineating north, south, east and west are clear and easy to read. The rest of the stamp is undecipherable and lends mystery to the road's origin.

This area is illuminated.
